belualis: <entryFree id="n5156" type="hapax" key="be_lu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭālis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>belua</etym>, <sense id="n5156.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brutish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">educatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 11, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
beluatus: <entryFree id="n5157" type="hapax" key="be_lu^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5157.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ornamented</hi> or <hi rend="ital">embroidered with figures of animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tapetia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
beluilis: <entryFree id="n5158" type="main" key="be_lu^i_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭīlis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5158.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brutal</hi> (post-class.): beluile <foreign lang="greek">qhriw=des</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">beluile saevientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3:88" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. M. 3, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:3:55" default="NO">3, 55</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beluinus: <entryFree id="n5159" type="main" key="be_lu^i_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭīnus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5159.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brutal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">animal</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1672,001:Rer. Gest. Alex. 3:54" default="NO"><author>Jul. Val.</author> Rer. Gest. Alex. 3, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
belunum: <entryFree id="n5160" type="main" key="Be_lu_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlūnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5160.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the capital city of a people of Venetia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Belluno</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 110</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 69</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3549</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beluosus: <entryFree id="n5161" type="main" key="be_lu^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5161.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in beasts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">monsters</hi>: Oceanus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 47</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Ora Marit. 204</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
belus: <entryFree id="n5162" type="main" key="Be_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bh=los</foreign>; Heb. <foreign />. <sense id="n5162.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Asiatic king of a primitive age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">builder of Babylon and founder of the Babylonian kingdom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:621" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 621</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 729</bibl> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">priscus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 213</bibl></cit> (like <foreign lang="greek">*bh=los o( a)rxai=os</foreign>, Aelian. V. H. 13, 3).—</sense><sense id="n5162.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Indian deity</hi>, compared with Hercules of the Greeks, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:16:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 16, 42</bibl>; cf. Robinson, Dict., under <foreign />.—</sense><sense id="n5162.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Danaus and Ægyptus.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n5162.3" n="IV" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5162.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlīdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (for the length of the <hi rend="ital">i</hi>, cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 584</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bhli/dhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a male descendant of Belus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Belidae fratres,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Danaus and Ægyptus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:291" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 291</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surge, age, Belide, de tot modo fratribus unus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Lynceus</tr>, <tr>son of Ægyptus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Palamedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit> (septimo gradu a Belo originem ducens, Serv.).—</sense><sense id="n5162.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and usu. in <number>plur.</number>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlĭdĕs</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">the granddaughters of Belus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Belides</hi>, = Danaides (v. Danaus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:62" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 463</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5162.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēlĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = Belis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 961" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 961</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5162.7" n="V" level="1"> Beli oculus, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cat</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-eye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a species of onyx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 55, § 149</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5162.8" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Galilee</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Phœnicia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Nahr Naaman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 19, 17, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
belutus: <entryFree id="n5163" type="gloss" key="be_lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlūtus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a</itype>, um: bestiae similis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=34" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 34</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
beluus: <entryFree id="n5164" type="gloss" key="be_lu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēlŭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bell-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, = beluinus, Gloss. Isid.</entryFree>
bembinadia: <entryFree id="n5165" type="main" key="Bembinadi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bembinadĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5165.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district in Arcadia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 6, 10, § 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
benacus: <entryFree id="n5166" type="main" key="Be_na_cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēnācus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bh/vakos</foreign>, Strabo: lacus, <sense id="n5166.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deep and rough lake in</hi> Gallia Transpadana, <hi rend="ital">near Verona</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through which the Mincius</hi> (Mincio) <hi rend="ital">flows</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago di Garda</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 103, 106, § 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:75" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 22, 38, § 75</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Benacus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 205</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēnācenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the people</hi> <cb n="BENE" /> <hi rend="ital">dwelling near Lake Benacus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 260, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bendidius: <entryFree id="n5167" type="main" key="Bendi^di_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bendĭdīus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bendi/deios</foreign>, <sense id="n5167.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Bendis</hi> (<foreign lang="greek">*be/ndis</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Thracian Diana</hi> or <hi rend="ital">goddess of the moon</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 41, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bene: <entryFree id="n5168" type="main" key="be^ne^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕ</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> of manner and intensity [bonus; the first vowel assimilated to the <sense id="n5168.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">e</hi> of the foll. syllable; cf. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 366], <hi rend="ital">well</hi> (<hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> melius, <hi rend="ital">better; sup.</hi> optime [v. bonus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>], <hi rend="ital">best;</hi> often to be rendered by more specific Engl. adverbs). </sense><sense id="n5168.1" n="I" level="1"> As adjunct of verbs. </sense><sense id="n5168.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n5168.3" n="1" level="3"> Of physical or external goodness, usefulness, ornament, and comfort: <cit><quote lang="la">villam rusticam bene aedificatam habere expedit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">villam bonam beneque aedificatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est agrum bene colere? Bene arare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agro bene culto nihil potest esse... uberius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi cocta erit bene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">32 et saep.: te auratam et vestitam bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 50</bibl></cit>: ornatus hic satis me condecet? <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Optume, <hi rend="ital">it is very becoming</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me bene curatā cute vises,</quote> <trans><tr>well tended</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene olere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene sonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tamen non inprimis bene habitavit,</quote> <trans><tr>in the very best style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Catone cum quaereretur, quid maxime in re familiari expediret, respondet Bene pascere? Quid secundum? Satis bene pascere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:25:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 25, 89</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">bene cenare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 13, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene de rebus domesticis constitutum esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be in good circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:45:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 45, 97</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">similarly: rem (i. e. familiarem) bene paratam comitate perdidit,</quote> <trans><tr>well arranged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.4" n="2" level="3"> With respect to the mind. </sense><sense id="n5168.5" n="a" level="4"> Perception, knowledge, ability: <cit><quote lang="la">quas tam bene noverat quam paedagogos nostros novimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin melius novi quam te et vidi saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novi optime (Bacchus) et saepe vidi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui optime suos nosse deberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 22</bibl>: satin' haec meministi et tenes? <hi rend="ital">Pa.</hi> Melius quam tu qui docuisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eo mihi melius cernere videor quo ab eo proprius absum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hic melius quam ipse illa scire videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 38, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Sophocles vel optime scripserit Electram suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gubernatoris ars quia bene navigandi rationem habet,</quote> <trans><tr>of able seamanship</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius in Volscis imperatum est,</quote> <trans><tr>better generalship was displayed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil melius quam omnis mundus administratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: de medico bene existimari scribis, <hi rend="ital">that he is well thought</hi> (<hi rend="ital">spoken</hi>) <hi rend="ital">of</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">his ability</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prudentibus et bene institutis,</quote> <trans><tr>well educated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientibus et bene naturā constitutis,</quote> <trans><tr>endowed with good natural talent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quodsi melius geruntur ea quae consilio geruntur quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>more ably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:34:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabulas bene pictas collocare in bono lumine,</quote> <trans><tr>good paintings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:261" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75, 261</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canere melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:91" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene pronuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene respondere interrogationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:81" default="NO">6, 3, 81</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.6" n="b" level="4"> Of feeling, judgment, and will: <cit><quote lang="la">similis in utroque nostrum, cum optime sentiremus, error fuit,</quote> <trans><tr>when we had the best intentions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4, 2</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bene sentire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bene, optime de re publicā sentire,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold sound views on public affairs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:41:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 41, 149</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene animatas eas (insulas) confirmavit,</quote> <trans><tr>well disposed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei causae quam Pompeius animatus melius quam paratus susceperat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; so, optime animati, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 201, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bene cogitasti aliquando, laudo,</quote> <trans><tr>that you had good intentions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vero bene sperare (i. e. de bello),</quote> <trans><tr>had good hopes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sperabis omnia optime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi bene ex animo volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; so freq.: bene alicui velle, v. volo: bene aliquid consulere, <hi rend="ital">to plan something well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilando, agendo, bene consulendo prospera omnia cedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia non bene consulta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 92, 2</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5168.7" n="c" level="4"> Of morality, honesty, honor, etc. </sense><sense id="n5168.8" n="(a)" level="5"> Bene vivere, or bene beateque vivere ( = <foreign lang="greek">kalw=s ka)gaqw=s</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">to lead a moral and happy</hi> <cb n="BENE" /> <hi rend="ital">life</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui virtutem habeat, eum nullius rei ad bene vivendum indigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:51:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 51, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dialecticā vestrā nullam esse ad melius vivendum vim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ni ita accideret et melius et prudentius viveretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:19:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 19, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 3</bibl> et saep. (for another meaning of bene vivere, cf. e. infra).—</sense><sense id="n5168.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Bene mori, <hi rend="ital">to die honorably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bravely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">creditably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloriously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se bene mori quam turpiter vivere maluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:50:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 50, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ferrum quidem ad bene moriendum oblaturus est hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 42, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum potui, Medea, mori bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.10" n="(g)" level="5"> Bene partum, <hi rend="ital">what is honestly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honorably earned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acquired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa bona bene parta habemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mei patris bene parta indiligenter Tutatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res familiaris primum bene parta sit, nullo neque turpi quaestu, neque odioso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diutine uti bene licet partum bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 42</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mala parta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male par tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n5168.11" n="(d)" level="5"> Apud bonos bene agier, an old legal formula: bonā fide agi (v. bonus), <hi rend="ital">to be transacted in good faith among good men.</hi> ubi erit illa formula fiduciae ut inter bonos bene agier oportet? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 17, 70</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Non bene = male, <hi rend="ital">not faithfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse metus coepit ne jura jugalia conjunx Non bene servasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 716</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.12" n="d" level="4"> Representing an action as right or correct, <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correctly</hi>: bene mones, Ibo, <hi rend="ital">you are right</hi> (<hi rend="ital">to admonish me</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequi recusarunt bene monentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quom mihi et bene praecipitis, et, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>since you give sound advice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 80</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 372, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene enim majores accubitionem epularem amicorum convivium nominarunt, melius quam Graeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 13, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc bene censuit Scaevola,</quote> <trans><tr>correctly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:48" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.13" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pleasantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satisfactorily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">profitably</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">successfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc bene vivo et fortunate atque ut volo atque animo ut lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil adferrent quo jucundius, id est melius, viveremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:41:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 41, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bene qui cenat, bene vivit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 56</bibl></cit>: quamobrem melius apud bonos quam apud fortunatos beneficium collocari puto, <hi rend="ital">is better</hi> or <hi rend="ital">more profitably invested</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perdenda sunt multa beneficia ut semel ponas bene, Sen. Ben. poët. 1, 2, 1: etiamsi nullum (beneficium) bene positurus sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando hoc bene successit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 23</bibl></cit>: bene ambulatum'st? <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Huc quidem, hercle, ad te bene, Quia tui vivendi copia'st, <hi rend="ital">has your walk been pleasant?</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius ominare,</quote> <trans><tr>use words of better omen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:96:329" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 96, 329</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se suamque aetatem bene curant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 36</bibl></cit>.—So, bene (se) habere: ut bene me haberem filiai nuptiis, <hi rend="ital">have a good time at</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se bene habet suisque amicis usui est,</quote> <trans><tr>who enjoys his life and is a boon companion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam hanc bene se habere aetatem nimio'st aequius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: bene consulere alicui, <hi rend="ital">to take good care for somebody</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s interests</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuae rei bene consulere cupio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut qui mihi consultum optume velit esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me optime consulentem saluti suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se ad sapientes viros bene consulentes rei publicae contulerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:13:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 13, 46</bibl></cit>.—So, bene mereri, and rarely bene merere, <hi rend="ital">to deserve well of one</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">act for his advantage; absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">addecet Bene me, renti bene referre gratiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Licinii aps te bene merenti male refertur gratia?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut memorem in bene meritos animum praestarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogor nonnumquam homines non optime de me meritos rogatu eorum qui bene meriti sunt, defendere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam bene meritis de nomine Punico militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bene quid de te merui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 317</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 7, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">66, 139</bibl>; 68, 142; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:36:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 36, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:14:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 14, 36</bibl> et saep.; v. mereo, D. and <pos>P. a.</pos>—So esp. referring to price: bene emere, <hi rend="ital">to buy advantageously</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">cheaply;</hi> bene vendere, <hi rend="ital">to sell advantageously</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">at a high price</hi>: bene ego hercle vendidi te, Plaut. <pb n="230" /> <cb n="BENE" /> Durc. 4, 2, 34: <cit><quote lang="la">et quoniam vendat, velle quam optime vendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 12, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita nec ut emat melius, nec ut vendat quidquam, simulabit vir bonus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 15, 61</bibl></cit>: vin' bene emere? <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Vin' tu pulcre vendere? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius emetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 1</bibl></cit>: quo melius emptum sciatis, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vitā bene credat emi honorem,</quote> <trans><tr>cheaply</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 206</bibl></cit>; Sil 4, 756.—</sense><sense id="n5168.14" n="f" level="4"> Expressing kindness, thanks, etc.: bene facis, bene vocas, bene narras, <hi rend="ital">I thank you</hi>, <hi rend="ital">am obliged to you for doing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">calling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saying</hi> (colloq.): merito amo te. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Bene facis, <hi rend="ital">thanks!</hi> Ter Eun. 1, 2, 106; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in consuetudinem venit, bene facis et fecisti non mdicantis esse, sed gratias agentis, Don. ad loc.' placet, bene facitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 43</bibl></cit>: dividuom talentum faciam. <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Bene facis, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 52</bibl>: si quid erit dubium, immutabo <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Bene fecisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 40</bibl> <hi rend="ital">Lo.</hi> Adeas, si velis. <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Bene hercle factum vobis habeo gratiam. Accedam propius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 3, 10</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">gratiam habere</hi>: bene fecisti; <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam habeo maximam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bene benigneque arbitror te facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 130</bibl></cit>: quin etiam Graecis licebit utare cum voles ... Bene sane facis, sed enitar ut Latine loquar, <hi rend="ital">I thank you for the permission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 7, 25</bibl>: an exitum Cassi Maelique expectem? Bene facitis quod abominamini... sed, etc., <hi rend="ital">I am much obliged to you for abhorring this</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 18, 9</bibl>: bene edepol narras; nam illi faveo virgini, <hi rend="ital">thanks for telling me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 7</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">male hercule narras,</quote> <trans><tr>I owe you little thanks for saying so</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:6:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">bene, ita me di ament, nuntias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benenarras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 33, 2</bibl>: tu ad matrem adi. Bene vocas; benigne dicis Cras apud te, <hi rend="ital">thanks for your invitation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">but</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 108</bibl>: eamus intro ut prandeamus. <hi rend="ital">Men.</hi> Bene vocas, tam gratia'st, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.15" n="g" level="4"> Of accuracy, etc., <hi rend="ital">well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accurately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">completely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ceterae partes aetatis bene descriptae sint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui bene librato... Obstitit ramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at bene si quaeras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi comprimam linguam. Hau potes: Bene pudiceque adservatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene dissimulare amorem,</quote> <trans><tr>entirely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim bene celat amorem?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 37</bibl></cit>.—So with a negation, = male restat parvam quod non bene compleat urnam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 615</bibl>: non bene conveniunt ... Majestas et amor, id. ib 2, 846.—Redundant, with <hi rend="ital">vix</hi> (Ovid.): <cit><quote lang="la">vix bene Castalio descenderat antro, Incustoditam lente videt ire juvencam ( = vix descenderat cum, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactum vix bene limen erat, Aesonides, dixi, quid agit meus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix bene desieram, rettulit illa mihi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> F 5, 277</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.16" n="h" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">most opportunely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at the nick of time</hi> (comic): <cit><quote lang="la">sed eccum meum gnatum optume video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed optume eccum exit senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit>. optume adveniens, puere, cape Chlamydem, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 69</bibl>: Davum optume Video, Ter And. 2, 1, 35; 4, 2, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 5, 2</bibl>. <orth extent="full" lang="la">—</orth>;</sense><sense id="n5168.17" n="i" level="4"> Pregn.: bene polliceri = large polliceri, <hi rend="ital">to make liberal promises</hi> ' praecepit ut ceteros adeant, bene polliceantur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 41:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 41, 5</bibl>; cf.: bene promittere, <hi rend="ital">to promise success</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae autem inconstantia deorum ut primis minentur extis, bene promittant secundis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 17, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.18" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n5168.19" n="1" level="3"> Bene dicere. </sense><sense id="n5168.20" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To speak well</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">eloquently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui optime dicunt,</quote> <trans><tr>the most eloquent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:26:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 26, 119</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam bene dicere haud absurdum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abunde dixit bene quisquis rei satisfecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cf: bene loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>to use good language</tr>, <tr>speak good Latin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:58:212:64:228" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 58, 212, 64, 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.21" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To speak ably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo oratorem melius quam ipsos illos quorum eae sint artes esse dicturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:15:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 15, 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 4</bibl>. bene dicendi scientia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.22" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To speak correctly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elegantly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum et Attice dicere et optime, ut ..bene dicere id sit, Attice dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 4, 13</bibl></cit>' optime dicta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl>.—So, bene loqui: <cit><quote lang="la">ut esset perfecta illa bene loquendi laus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:252" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 72, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at loquitur pulchre. Num melius quam Plato?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 5, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5168.23" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To speak well</hi>, i e. <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to praise</hi> <cb n="BENE" /> <hi rend="ital">him; absol.</hi> or with <case>dat.</case>, or <hi rend="ital">reflex.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inter</hi> (less correctly as one word, benedicere): cui bene dixit umquam bono? <hi rend="ital">Of what good man has he ever spoken well</hi>, or, <hi rend="ital">what good man has he ever praised</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:52:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 52, 110</bibl>. bene, quaeso, inter vos dicatis, et amice absenti tamen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 31</bibl>.—Ironically: <cit><quote lang="la">bene equidem tibi dico qui te digna ut eveniant precor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tibi cessaret doctus bene dicere lector,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: cui a viris bonis bene dicatur, Metell. Numid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:11:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 11, 3</bibl>.— And <hi rend="ital">dat</hi> understood: <cit><quote lang="la">si bene dicatis (i. e. mihi) vostra ripa vos sequar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>' omnes bene dicunt (ei), et amant (eum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bene dicendum (i e. alteri) delectandumque redacti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep 2, 1, 155</bibl></cit>—<mood>Part.</mood> ' indignis si male dicitur, male dictum id esse duco; <cit><quote lang="la">Verum si dignis dicitur, bene dictum'st,</quote> <trans><tr>is a praise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:27 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 27 sq.</bibl></cit>: nec bene nec male dicta profuerunt ad confirmandos animos, Liv 23, 46, 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 20</bibl> infra. —Bene audio = bene dicitur mihi, <hi rend="ital">I am praised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene dictis si certasset, audisset bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. prol. 20</bibl></cit>; v. audio, 5.—</sense><sense id="n5168.24" n="e" level="4"> To use words of good omen (<foreign lang="greek">eu)fhmei=n</foreign>): <hi rend="ital">Ol.</hi> Quid si fors aliter quam voles evenerit? <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Bene dice, dis sum fretus ( = fave linguā, melius ominare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 38</bibl> heja, bene dicito, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 3, 3, 155</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.25" n="f" level="4"> Bene dixisti, a formula of approbation: ne quan do iratus tu alio conferas. <hi rend="ital">Th.</hi> Bene dixti, <hi rend="ital">you are right</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 1, 61</bibl>. bene et sapienter dixti dudum, etc., <hi rend="ital">it was a good and wise remark of yours that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.26" n="g" level="4"> Bene dicta, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">specious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plausible words</hi> (opp. deeds): <cit><quote lang="la">bene dictis tuis bene facta aures meae expostulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 25</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bene loqui: male corde consultare, Bene linguā loqui,</quote> <trans><tr>use fine words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5168.27" n="2" level="3"> Bene facere. </sense><sense id="n5168.28" n="a" level="4"> Bene aliquid facere, <hi rend="ital">to do</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>, <hi rend="ital">something well</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ably</hi> (v. I. A. 2. a. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">vel non facere quod non op time possis, vel facere quod non pessime facias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:20:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 20, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tamen haec quia possunt bene aliquando fieri passim facienda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem Phidias optime fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so, melius facere, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 1</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid labor aut bene facta juvant?</quote> <trans><tr>his labor and well-done works are no pleasure to him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:525" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 525</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5168.29" n="b" level="4"> Bene facere, with <hi rend="ital">dat. absol.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>, or with <hi rend="ital">erga</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to do a good action</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to benefit somebody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to impart benefits</hi> (less cor rectly as one word, benefacio) </sense><sense id="n5168.30" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonus bonis bene feceris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene si amico feceris, ne pigeat fecisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malo bene facere tantumdem est periculum quantum bono male facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homini id quod tu facis bene,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep 1, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi lubens bene faxim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:5:6:5:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 5, 6, 5, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 8, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at tibi di semper... faciant bene,</quote> <trans><tr>may the gods bless you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:7:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 7, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di tibi Bene faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 18</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bonis bene fit beneficium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchrum est bene facere reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego ne ingratis quidem bene facere absistam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 35, 4</bibl></cit>.—Reflexively. sibi bene facere, <hi rend="ital">enjoy one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have a good time</hi>, genio indulgere (v. I. A. 2. e. supra): nec quisquam est tam ingenio duro quin, ubi quidquam occasionis sit sibi faciat bene, Plaut. As. grex 5.—</sense><sense id="n5168.31" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam bene quae in me fecerunt, ingrata ea habui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5168.32" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">erga</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid amicum erga bene feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.33" n="(d)" level="5"> With ellipsis of <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to impart benefits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingrata atque irrita esse omnia intellego Quae dedi et quod bene feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bene fecisti, referetur gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego quod bene feci, male feci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si beneficia in rebus, non in ipsā benefaciendi voluntate consisterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benefaciendi animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:19:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.—So esp. in formula of thanks, etc.' bene benigneque arbitror te facere, <hi rend="ital">I thank you heartily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 129</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">Jup.</hi> Jam nunc irata non es? <hi rend="ital">Alc.</hi> Non sum. <hi rend="ital">Jup.</hi> Bene facis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 2, 56</bibl>; v Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 384</bibl>.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕ facta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">benefits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefactions</hi> (cf. beneficium): bene facta male locata male facta arbitror, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 62</bibl> (Trag. v 429 Vahl.): pol, bene facta tua <cb n="BENE" /> me hortantur tuo ut imperio paream, Plaut <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:2:65" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 2, 65</bibl>: pro bene factis ejus uti ei pretium possim reddere. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:Capt. 5:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">bene facta referre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 3, 182</bibl></cit> tenere, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl>.—So freq. in eccl. writ ers: <cit><quote lang="la">et si bene feceritis his qui vobis bene faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene facite his qui oderunt vos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 5, 44</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">to do good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perform meritorious acts</hi> (in <hi rend="ital">fin. verb</hi> only eccl. Lat.)' discite bene facere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogo vos si licet sabbatis bene facere an male,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui bene facit, ex Deo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,004:Ep. 3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Joan. Ep. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.— In <hi rend="ital">P a.</hi> (class.): bene facta (almost always in <number>plur.</number>), <hi rend="ital">merits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meritorious acts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brave deeds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene facta recte facta sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par 3, 1, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia bene facta in luce se collocari volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 26, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene facta mea reipublicae procedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J 85:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J 85, 5</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 19</bibl>: veteribus bene factis nova pensantes maleficia, Liv 37, 1, 2; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:13:12:1:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 13, 12, 1, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:850" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 850</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 386</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: bene factum a vobis, dum vivitis non abscedet, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1, 4</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) In medical language, <hi rend="ital">to be of good effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do good</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id bene faciet et alvum bonam faciet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 157, 6</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: ad capitis dolorem bene facit serpyllum, Scrib Comp. 1; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl>; 9; 13; 41.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) In the phrase bene facis, etc., as a formula of thanks, v I A. 2. f. supra.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) Expressing joy, <hi rend="ital">I am glad of it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am glad that</hi> etc. (comic.) <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Tua quae fuit Palaestra, ea filia inventa'st mea. <hi rend="ital">La.</hi> Bene meher cule factum'st, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 9</bibl>: bis tanto valeo quam valui prius. <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Bene hercle factum et gaudeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 27</bibl>; Ter And. 5, 6, 11; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene factum et volup est hodie me his mulierculis Tetulisse auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; so, bene factum gaudeo: nam hic noster pater est <hi rend="ital">Ant.</hi> Ita me Juppiter bene amet, benefac tum gaudeo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 47</bibl>; Ter Phorm. 5, 6, 43; cf.: <hi rend="ital">Me.</hi> Rex Creo vigiles nocturnos singulos semper locat. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Bene facit, quia nos eramus peregri, tutatu'st domum, <hi rend="ital">I am glad of it</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 19</bibl>. bene fecit A. Silius qui transegerit: neque enim ei deesse volebam, et quid possem timebam, <hi rend="ital">I am glad that A. Silius</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:24:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 24, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.34" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">esse.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5168.35" n="a" level="4"> Bene est, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is well.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5168.36" n="(a)" level="5"> In the epistolary formula: si vales bene est; or, si vales bene est, (ego) valeo (abbrev. S.V.B.E.V.), Afran. ap Prisc. p 804 P; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 34, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 7, 1</bibl>; 5, 9, 1; 5, 10, 1; 10, 33, 1; 10, 14, 8; 10, 14, 11; <cit><quote lang="la">14, 14, 1, 14, 14, 16: si valetis gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 41</bibl></cit>—These formulas were obsolete at Seneca's time: mos antiquis fuit, usque ad meam servatus aetatem, primis epistulae verbis adicere: Si vales, bene est; <cit><quote lang="la">ego valeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 15:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.37" n="(b)" level="5"> = bene factum est (cf. I. 2. k. supra): oculis quoque etiam plus jam video quam prius: <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Bene est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 26</bibl>: hic est intus filius apud nos tuus. <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Optume'st, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:48:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 48, 5, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.38" n="b" level="4"> Bene est alicui, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is</hi> (<hi rend="ital">goes</hi>) <hi rend="ital">well with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one does well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is well off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enjoys himself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is happy</hi>: nam si curent, bene bonis sit, male malis, quod nunc abest, Enn ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:32:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 32, 79</bibl> (Trag. v. 355 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">bona si esse veis, bene erit tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia illi, unde huc abvecta sum, malis bene esse solitum'st,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui neque tibi bene esse patere, et illis qui bus est invides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 35</bibl></cit> (so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 71</bibl>): num quippiam aluit me vis? <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Ut bene sit tibi, id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:8:5" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:Poen. 4:2:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 90</bibl>; Ter Phorm. 1, 2, 101: nemini nimium bene est, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 185</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">si non est, jurat bene solis esse maritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen illis bene erit, quia non bono gaudent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 11:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 11, 4</bibl></cit>: BENE SIT NOBIS, Inscr Orell. 4754; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: istas minas decem, qui me procurem dum melius sit mi, des. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spero ex tuis litteris tibi melius esse,</quote> <trans><tr>that your health is better</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 1</bibl>; Ter And. 2, 5, 16.—With <case>dat.</case> understood: patria est ubi cumque est bene (i. e. cuique), <hi rend="ital">where one does well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">there is his country</hi>, Poët. ap. Cic Tusc 5, 37, 108 (Trag. Rel. inc. p. 248 Rib). <pb n="231" /> <cb n="BENE" /> —With <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to be well off in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feast upon</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi illi bene sit ligno, aqua calida, cibo, vestimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at mihi bene erat, non piscibus, Sed pullo atque hoedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.39" n="c" level="4"> Bene sum = bene mihi est: <cit><quote lang="la">minore nusquam bene fui dispendio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de eo (argento) nunc bene sunt tuā virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: dato qui bene sit; <cit><quote lang="la">ego ubi bene sit tibi locum lepidum dabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scis bene esse si sit unde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.40" n="4" level="3"> Bene habere. </sense><sense id="n5168.41" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj. nom.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5168.42" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To enjoy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:35 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 35 al.</bibl>; v. I. A. 2. e. supra.—</sense><sense id="n5168.43" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To be favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to favor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene habent tibi principia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 82</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5168.44" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">well off.</hi> imperator se bene habet, <hi rend="ital">it is well with</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 24:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 24, 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si te bene habes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 122</bibl></cit> Brix ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n5168.45" n="b" level="4"> Hoc bene habet, or bene habet, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> ( = res se bene habet), <hi rend="ital">it is well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">matters stand well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene habet: jacta sunt fundamenta defensionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene habet: di pium movere bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque bene habet si a collegā litatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:557" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 557</bibl>.— So <hi rend="ital">pers.</hi>: bene habemus nos, si in his spes est; <cit><quote lang="la">opinor, aliud agamus,</quote> <trans><tr>we are well off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.46" n="5" level="3"> Bene agere, with <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n5168.47" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To treat one well</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene egissent Athenienses cum Miltiade si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>, ext. 3.—</sense><sense id="n5168.48" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: bene agitur cum aliquo, <hi rend="ital">it goes well with one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he is fortunate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene dicat secum esse actum,</quote> <trans><tr>that he has come off well</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam bene cum rebus humanis agitur ut meliora pluribus placeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.— With ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">cum</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hinc non abeo intestatus, bene agitur pro noxiā (sc. mecum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.49" n="6" level="3"> Rem (negotium) bene gerere. </sense><sense id="n5168.50" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To administer well private</hi> or <hi rend="ital">public affairs</hi>: multi suam rem bene gessere et publicam patriā procul, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 6, 1</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 295 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">non ut multis bene gestae, sed, ut nemini, conservatae rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">qui ordo bene gestae rei publicae testimonium multis, mihi uni conservatae dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollini republicā vestrā bene gestā servatāque... donum mittitote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.51" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To be successful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meet with success</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquit one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self well;</hi> usu. of war; <cit><quote lang="la">also of private affairs: bello extincto, re bene gestā, vobis gratis habeo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando bene gessi rem, volo hic in fano supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">quasi re bene gestā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem te valde bene gessisse rumor erat,</quote> <trans><tr>that you had met with great success</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 25, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclamant omnes occasionem negotii bene gerendi amittendam non esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cogitanti accidere visa est facultas bene rei gerendae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res bello bene gestae,</quote> <trans><tr>success in war</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laeti bene gestis corpora rebus Procurate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 157</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:25:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 25, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 37, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 47, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 30, 5</bibl>; 22, 25, 4; 23, 36, 2.—</sense><sense id="n5168.52" n="7" level="3"> Bene vertere, in wishes. </sense><sense id="n5168.53" n="(a)" level="5"> With the <hi rend="ital">rel. quod</hi> or <hi rend="ital">quae res</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to turn out well; absol.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae res tibi et gnatae tuae bene feliciterque vortat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod utrisque bene vertat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bene verteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 35, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:5" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 62, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 39, 10</bibl>; v. verto; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bene eveniat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.54" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">di</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subject</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">di bene vortant,</quote> <trans><tr>may the gods let it turn out well</tr>, <tr>may the gods grant success</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 3, 3, 19</bibl>; v. verte.—</sense><sense id="n5168.55" n="8" level="3"> Bene, colloquially in leave-taking: bene ambula, <hi rend="ital">walk well</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">have a pleasant walk!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 166</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Bene ambulato! <hi rend="ital">Ly.</hi> Bene vale! <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Merc 2, 2, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene valete et vivite!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives bene valete!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvere jubeo te, mi Saturides, bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: LAGGE, FILI, BENE QVIESCAS, Sepulch. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> p. 4755</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.56" n="9" level="3"> In invocations to the gods, often redundant (cf. bonus): <cit><quote lang="la">ita me Juppiter bene amet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di te bene ament, Hegio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me di bene ament,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Jane pater uti te... bonas preces bene precatus siem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 134</bibl></cit>: bene sponsis, beneque volueris in precatione augurali Messala augur ait significare spoponderis,<cb n="BENE" />  volueris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=351" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 351</bibl> Müll.
