(p. 267 Lind.).—</sense><sense id="n5168.57" n="10" level="3"> Elliptical expressions. </sense><sense id="n5168.58" n="(a)" level="5"> Bene, melius, optime, instead of bene, etc., dicit, dicis, or facit, facis, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene Pericles (i.e. dixit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1,40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene (Philippus) ministrum et praebitorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 14, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimabatur bene, Latine (i. e. loqui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:74:259" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 74, 259</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">at bene Areus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 15, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ante Aristippus, et ille melius (i.e. hoc dixerat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed haec tu melius vel optime omnium (i.e. facies),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 19, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 11, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 20, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:6:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 6, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:24" default="NO">10, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:3" default="NO">6, 1, 3</bibl>; 9, 4, 23.— </sense><sense id="n5168.59" n="(b)" level="5"> In applauding answers' bene and optime, <hi rend="ital">good! bravo! excellent!</hi> euge, euge! Perbene! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 75</bibl>: huc respice. <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Optume! <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.60" n="(g)" level="5"> In drinking health, with <case>acc.</case> or <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">health to you</hi>, <hi rend="ital">your health!</hi> bene vos! bene nos! bene te! bene me! bene nostram etiam Stephanium! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 27</bibl>; Tib 2, 1, 31: bene te, pater optime Caesar, etc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:637" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 637</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene mihi, bene vobis, bene amicae meae!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; Ov.A.A. 1, 601.—</sense><sense id="n5168.61" n="11" level="3"> Pregn., in ellipt. predicate: quod (imperium) si (ei) sui bene crediderint cives... credere et Latinos debere, <hi rend="ital">if his own citizens did well to intrust the supreme power to him</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:50:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 50, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Velia aedificent quibus melius quam P. Valerio creditur libertas,</quote> <trans><tr>to whom it will be safer to intrust liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:7:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius peribimus quam sine alteris vestrum viduae aut orbae vivemus,</quote> <trans><tr>it will be better for us to perish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene Arruntium morte usum,</quote> <trans><tr>that it was right for Arruntius to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:30:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 30, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:92" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.62" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv. of intensity</hi>, = valde, <hi rend="ital">very</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5168.63" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>: bene tempestate serenā, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 82</bibl> (Ann. v. 517 Vahl.): foedus feri bene firmum, id. ap. Porphyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 50</bibl> (Ann. v. 33 ib.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene firmus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 7, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene robustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene morigerus fuit puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene ergo ego hinc praedatus ibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene lautum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene et naviter oportet esse impudentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id utrum Romano more locutus sit, bene nummatum te futurum, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene sanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 21, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene longinquos dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:29:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 29, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem bene longum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:88:361" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 88, 361</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene magna caterva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:33:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 33, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Hisp. 4" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Hisp. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidum pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cautus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: multi, Pollio ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fam 10, 33, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo optime dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 23:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 23, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5168.64" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>: bene saepe libenter, Enn. Ann. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 239 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene libenter victitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene mane haec scripsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 10, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene penitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:70:section=169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 70, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene longe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Hisp. 25" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Hisp. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bene gnaviter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ot. Sap. 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ot. Sap. 1</bibl></cit> (28), 5.—With adverb. phrase: <cit><quote lang="la">siad te bene ante lucem venisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:64:259" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 2, 64, 259</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
benedice: <entryFree id="n5169" type="hapax" key="be^ne^di^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕdĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> of the <pos>adj.</pos>, not in use, <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>benedico</etym>, <sense id="n5169.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with friendly words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad se illicere blande ac benedice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
benedico: <entryFree id="n5170" type="main" key="be^ne^di_co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕdīco</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n5170.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to speak well of any one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to commend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5170.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., in class. Lat. always as two words, v. bene, I. B. 1.—</sense><sense id="n5170.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5170.3" n="A" level="2"> In late and eccl. Lat. with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n5170.4" n="1" level="3"> Deum, <hi rend="ital">to bless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praise</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">adore</hi> (Heb. <foreign />), App. Trism. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:112:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 112, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">benedici Deum omni tempore condecet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Orat. 3</bibl></cit>: Deus benedicendus, App. Trism. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jacob. 3, 9</bibl>.— Rarely with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">benedic Domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:102:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 102, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n5170.5" n="2" level="3"> Of men and things, <hi rend="ital">to bless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hallow</hi> (Heb. <foreign /> and <foreign />)' requievit die septimo eumque benedixit, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 14, 11</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 6, 41</bibl>: altarium, Sulp. de Vita S. Martini, 2, 2: benedictum oleum, Hier. Vit. Hilar. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">martyres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Mart. 1</bibl></cit>; Grut. 875, 3 al.—Sometimes with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">benedixit domui Israel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:113:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 113, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">64, 12</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5170.6" n="B" level="2"> Herba benedicta, <hi rend="ital">the plant also called</hi> lagopus or leporinus pes, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 61</bibl>.— <cb n="BENE" /> Hence, </sense><sense id="n5170.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕdictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (prop. as two words), v bene, I. B. 1. g.—</sense><sense id="n5170.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕ-dictus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an approved person</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blessed one</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">venite, benedicti Patris mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:25:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 25, 34 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
benedictio: <entryFree id="n5171" type="main" key="be^ne^dicti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕdictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>benedico, II.</etym> (eccl. Lat.), <sense id="n5171.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extolling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">praising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lauding</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 82, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 16, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Test. Anim. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5171.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a consecrated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">benedictio crucis = frustum sanctae crucis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 32</bibl></cit>, c. 8.—</sense><sense id="n5171.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A benediction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blessing</hi>, Sulp. de Vita S. Martini, 2, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:26:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 26, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gal. 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
benedictum: <entryFree id="n5172" type="main" key="be^ne^dictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕdictum</orth>, v. bene, I. B. 1. g.</entryFree>
benefacio: <entryFree id="n5173" type="main" key="be^ne^fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfăcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, better written as two words, v. bene, I. B. 2.</entryFree>
benefactio: <entryFree id="n5174" type="main" key="be^ne^facti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfactĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>benefacio</etym>, <sense id="n5174.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the performing of an act of kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a benefaction</hi>, Tert. c. Marc. 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
benefactor: <entryFree id="n5175" type="main" key="be^ne^factor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfactor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5175.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who confers a favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a benefaclor</hi> (late Lat.), Coripp. Laud. Anast. Quaest. 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Just. 1, 314</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
benefactum: <entryFree id="n5176" type="main" key="be^ne^factum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfactum</orth>, v. bene, I. B. 2.</entryFree>
benefice: <entryFree id="n5177" type="main" key="be^ne^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. beneficus <sense id="n5177.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
beneficentia: <entryFree id="n5178" type="main" key="be^ne^fi^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>from beneficus, like magnificentia, munificentia, from magnificus, munificus; cf. Beier and Gernh. upon <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 7, 20</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n5178.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of</hi> beneficus, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an honorable and kind treatment of others</hi> (opp. maleficentia, Lact. Ira Dei, 1, 1; several times in the philos. writings of Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewh. rare): quid praestantius bonitate et beneficentiā?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.D. 1, 43, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficentia, quam eandem vel benignitatem vel liberalitatem appellari licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:7:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 42</bibl> sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 15, 52 and 53: comitas ac beneficentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:84:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 84, 343</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti beneficentiā adversus supplices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficentia augebat ornabatque subjectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 13, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beneficiarius: <entryFree id="n5179" type="main" key="be^ne^fi^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfĭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>beneficium</etym>, <sense id="n5179.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a favor.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5179.1" n="I" level="1"> As <pos>adj.</pos> only once: <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5179.2" n="II" level="1"> Freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfĭcĭārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">soldiers who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">through the favor of their commander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">were exempt from menial offices</hi> (throwing up intrenchments, procuring wood and water, foraging, etc.), <hi rend="ital">free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">privileged soldiers</hi>: beneficiarii dicebantur milites, qui vacabant muneris beneficio; <cit><quote lang="la">e contrario munifices vocabantur, qui non vacabant, sed munus reipublicae faciebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Comm. p. 347: beneficiarii superiorum exercituum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 88</bibl></cit>. Such beneficiarii were usually in attendance upon their commanders, and were promoted by them to office: <foreign lang="greek">*benefikia/lioi oi( e)pi\ qerapei/a| tw=n *magistra/twn tetagme/noi</foreign>, Gloss.: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficiarii ab eo appellati quod promoventur beneficio tribunorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 21</bibl> (32); 10, 27 (36); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 192</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">929</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1394</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
beneficium: <entryFree id="n5180" type="main" key="be^ne^fi^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfĭcĭum</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĭfĭcĭ-um</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>beneficus</etym>. <sense id="n5180.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A benefaction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benefit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">service</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">eu)erge/thma</foreign> (sunt qui ita distinguunt, quaedam beneficia esse, quaedam officia, quaedam ministeria. Beneficium esse, quod alienus det: <cit><quote lang="la">alienus est, qui potuit sine reprehensione cessare: officium esse filii, uxoris et earum personarum, quas necessitudo suscitat et ferre opem jubet: ministerium esse servi, quem condicio sua eo loco posuit, ut nihil eorum, quae praestat, imputet superiori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben.3:18:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben.3, 18, 1</bibl></cit>);—(in prose freq.; in poetry, for metrical reasons, only in play-writers; most freq. in Ter.). </sense><sense id="n5180.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum beneficium esse duco id, quod, quoi facias, non placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro maleficio beneficium reddere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immemor beneficii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio aliquos parere amicos beneficio meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficium verbis initum re comprobare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim si tuam ob causam cuiquam commodes, beneficium illud habendum est, sed feneratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:35:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 35, 117</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2</bibl>. 20, 70: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficio adligari: beneficio victus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 33, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jugurtham beneficiis vincere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:49 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 15, 49 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 20, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 8, 3</bibl>' deferre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 15, 49</bibl>: conferre in aliquem,<pb n="232" /> <cb n="BENE" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 45</bibl>: quia magna mihi debebat beneficia, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in republicā multo praestat benefici quam malefici immemorem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus et populus Romanus benefici et injuriae memor esse solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 104:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 104, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 126, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in iis (hominibus) beneficio ac maleficio abstineri aecum censent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortali memoriā retinere beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11, 5 al.</bibl></cit>—Of the <hi rend="ital">favor</hi> of the people in giving their vote: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid hoc beneficio populi Romani atque hac potestate praetoriā possum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 24, 69</bibl></cit>, and 71.—</sense><sense id="n5180.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5180.3" n="1" level="3"> Beneficio, <hi rend="ital">through favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mediation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficio tuo salvus,</quote> <trans><tr>thanks to you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 35, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri consulatūs beneficio,</quote> <trans><tr>by means of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servari beneficio Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:71:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 71, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc beneficio,</quote> <trans><tr>by this means</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortium beneficio,</quote> <trans><tr>by the lucky turn of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53</bibl></cit> Herz.: <cit><quote lang="la">longissimae aetatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:121" default="NO">5, 10, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 8 al.</bibl></cit>; cf.: fortunae beneficium, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 4, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5180.4" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">by the agency of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod beneficio ejus contingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:40:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 40, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficio furis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:46" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 2, 46</bibl></cit> pr.—</sense><sense id="n5180.5" n="2" level="3"> Alicujus beneficii facere (habere, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to make dependent on one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s bounty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">favor</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">commeatus a senatu peti solitos benefici sui fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut munus imperii beneficii sui faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo quidem dominis servi beneficia possunt dare, ut ipsos saepe beneficii sui fecerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:18:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed nihil habebimus nisi beneficii alieni?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5180.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to political life. </sense><sense id="n5180.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A distinction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">promotion</hi> (esp. freq. after the Aug. per.): <cit><quote lang="la">coöptatio collegiorum ad populi beneficium transferebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:36:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 36, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus omnia populi Romani beneficia dormientibus deferuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:70:section=180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 70, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in beneficiis ad aerarium delatus,</quote> <trans><tr>among those recommended to favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 5, 11</bibl></cit> Halm. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum suo magno beneficio esset,</quote> <trans><tr>under great obligation to his recommendation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 6</bibl></cit> Wernsd.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:92" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 92</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl>.—So, </sense><sense id="n5180.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp. freq. of <hi rend="ital">military promotions</hi> (whence beneficiarius, q. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">quod scribis de beneficiis, scito a me et tribunos militaris et praefectos... delatos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tribuni militum... quae antea dictatorum et consulum ferme fuerant beneficia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficia gratuita esse populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:42:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 42, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 54:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 54, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per beneficia Nymphidii,</quote> <trans><tr>promoted</tr>, <tr>advanced through the favor of Nymphidius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 48</bibl> Lips.: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficii sui centuriones,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>his creatures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber beneficiorum or Beneficium,</quote> <trans><tr>the book in which the public lands that were bestowed were designated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Limit. Const. p. 193" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Limit. Const. p. 193</bibl></cit> Goes.; Arcad. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:page=260" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 260</bibl>.—So, SERVVS. A. COMMENTARIIS. BENEFICIORVM., <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 578, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5180.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A privilege</hi>, <hi rend="ital">right</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">anulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:7:42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:18" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:1:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 29, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, liberorum, <hi rend="ital">a release from the office of judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">received in consequence of having a certain number of children</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:8:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 8, 1, § 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5180.10" n="C" level="2"> Personified, as a god: <cit><quote lang="la">duos omnino (deos credere), Poenam et Beneficium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
beneficus: <entryFree id="n5181" type="main" key="be^ne^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfĭcus</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĭfĭcus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bene-facio</etym> (<sense id="n5181.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> regularly formed, beneficentior, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:5:9:2" default="NO">5, 9, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:25:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 25, 64</bibl>; ante-class. beneficissimus, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 603</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">generous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">de Ptolemaeo rege optimo et beneficissimo, Cato, l. l.: beneficum esse oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi beneficus, si nemo alterius causā benigne facit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt enim benefici generique hominum amici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:49:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 49, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beneficus, salutaris, mansuetus civis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 9, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:34:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 34, 5</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">beneficently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
benefio: <entryFree id="n5182" type="main" key="be^ne^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕfīo</orth>, v. benefacio.</entryFree>
beneolentia: <entryFree id="n5183" type="main" key="be^ne^o^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕŏlentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bene-oleo</etym>, <sense id="n5183.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a smelling agreeably</hi> (late Lat.), Hieron. in Dindym. Spir. Sanc. 11.</sense></entryFree>
beneplaceo: <entryFree id="n5184" type="main" key="be^ne_pla^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnē-plăcĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n5184.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="BENE" /> <hi rend="ital">please</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnēplăcĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acceptable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 34, 21</bibl>; Ambros. lsaac et An. 7, 57 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnē-plăcĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">good pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gracious purpose</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,010:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eph. 1, 9</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
beneventum: <entryFree id="n5185" type="main" key="Be^ne^ventum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕnĕventum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*beneou/enton</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">*benou/enton</foreign>, Strab. [bene-ventus], <sense id="n5185.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very ancient city of the Hirpini</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Samnium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Benevento</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl>; acc. to fable (<bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 9</bibl>; Sol. c. 11), founded by Diomedes; <cit><quote lang="la">it became a flourishing Roman colony 485 A.U.C.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:7" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 9, § 59</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called Maleventum on account of its unwholesome air,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=340:8" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 340, 8</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=34:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 34, 14</bibl> ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9,27, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 15, 1</bibl>; situated on the high-road towards the south of Italy; hence, much resorted to in warlike expeditions, as in the two Punic wars; <cit><quote lang="la">after it was colonized by Augustus, it was called Julia Concordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 103" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 103</bibl></cit> (abounding in the ruins of a former age).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕnĕventā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Beneventum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:15:section=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 15, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sutor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:46" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 46</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕnĕventāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Beneventines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:ad Cic. Verr. 2:1:15" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> ad Cic. Verr. 2, 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
benevole: <entryFree id="n5186" type="main" key="be^ne^vo^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕvŏlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. benevolus <sense id="n5186.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
benevolens: <entryFree id="n5187" type="main" key="be^ne^vo^lens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕ-vŏlens</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĭvŏ-lens</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bene-volo</etym>, <sense id="n5187.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wishing well</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benevolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi> (ante-class. for the class. benevolus; <cit><quote lang="la">in Plaut. very freq.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit> and 8: <cit><quote lang="la">ero benevolens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus multum benevolens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentes inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite cum dis benevolentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentem cum benevolente perire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sodalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:71 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 71 al.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>, and <pos>adv.</pos>, v. benevolus.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕvŏlens</orth>, <itype>ntis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a well-wisher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friend</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui amicus et benevolens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 42 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi benivolens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 47</bibl></cit> Fleck.</sense></entryFree>
benevolentia: <entryFree id="n5188" type="main" key="be^ne^vo^lenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕvŏlentĭa</orth> (better than <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĭvŏ-lentĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>benevolus</etym>, <sense id="n5188.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">good-will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benevolence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendship</hi> (diff. from amor, q.v.; <cit><quote lang="la">in good class. prose, most freq. in Cic., esp. in Lael. and Off.): amor, ex quo amicitia nominata, princeps est ad benevolentiam conjungendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 9, 1</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 63</bibl> (Fleck. sapientia): <cit><quote lang="la">capere, movere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declarare,</quote> <trans><tr>to express</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudinis animos ad benevolentiam allicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comparare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjungere sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:20:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus benevolentiam consequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acquirere sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conligere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tuā erga me benevolentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:60:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 60, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiderare benevolentiam,</quote> <trans><tr>good-will</tr>, <tr>readiness</tr>, <tr>willingness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentia singularis,</quote> <trans><tr>an exceeding friendliness of feeling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo benevolentiā in aliquem certare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5188.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5188.2" n="A" level="2"> In the jurists, <hi rend="ital">mildness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benignity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulgence</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interponere benevolentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:52" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:20" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5188.3" n="B" level="2"> In <number>plur.</number> (post-class.), <hi rend="ital">kind conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly services</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non in benevolentiis segnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
benevolus: <entryFree id="n5189" type="main" key="be^ne^vo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕ-vŏlus</orth> (in MSS. and inscrr. often <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĭvŏlus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>volo</etym>, <sense id="n5189.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">well-wishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benevolent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi> (class. for the ante-class. benevolens, from which it borrows the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.;</hi> cf. malevolus): <cit><quote lang="la">erga aliquem benevolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis benivolusque tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit> Fleck.: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolum efficere auditorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolos auditores habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut benevolos beneque existimantes efficiamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:79:322" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 79, 322</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:5" default="NO">4, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:48" default="NO">10, 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">benevolentior tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 60, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officium benevolentissimi atque amicissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturā benevolentissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5189.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of servants, <hi rend="ital">devoted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">yielding willing service</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus domino benevolus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 176</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnĕvŏlē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">benevolently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, Cic. Fin. <cb n="BENI" /> 1, 10, 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 21, 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Aur. 64" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Aur. 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beni: <entryFree id="n5190" type="main" key="Beni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Beni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5190.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian people on the Hebrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
benigne: <entryFree id="n5191" type="main" key="be^nigne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnignē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. benignus.</entryFree>
benignitas: <entryFree id="n5192" type="main" key="be^nigni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnignĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>benignus</etym>, <sense id="n5192.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of one</hi> benignus, <hi rend="ital">an affable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind bearing to others.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5192.1" n="I" level="1"> Of feeling or external conduct, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courtesy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benevolence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benignity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad vortendum huc animum adest benignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justitia, cui sunt adjunctae pietas, bonitas, liberalitas, benignitas, comitas, quaeque sunt generis ejusdem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:23:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 23, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etsi me attentissimis animis summā cum benignitate auditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 13, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 14, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:83:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 83, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 12, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignitas animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:25" default="NO">1, 3, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5192.2" n="II" level="1"> Of deeds, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberality</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bounty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">num solus ille dona dat? nunc ubi meam Benignitatem sensisti in te claudier?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 84</bibl></cit> (intellegit se et dona obtulisse, et id benigne saepe fecisse, Don.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa quanta benignitas naturae, quod tam multa ad vescendum, tam varia, tamque jucunda gignit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:53:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 53, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">largitio, quae fit ex re familiari, fontem ipsum benignitatis exhaurit. Ita benignitate benignitas tollitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne benignitas major esset quam facultates,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicorum benignitas exhausta est in eā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Volumnius) benignitatem per se gratam comitate adjuvabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42, 5</bibl></cit>: satis superque me benignitas tua Ditavit, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:31" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 31</bibl>; August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignitate deūm fractae hostium vires,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 14, 6</bibl>.— In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">vides, benignitates hominum ut periere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5192.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Lenity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mercy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitas legum cum aliquo temperamento benignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:19:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 19, 11</bibl></cit> pr.; 1, 3, 25.</sense></entryFree>
benigniter: <entryFree id="n5193" type="main" key="be^nigni^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnignĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (ante-class. for benigne), <sense id="n5193.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benignly</hi>, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 510, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1010</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
benignor: <entryFree id="n5194" type="main" key="be^nignor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnignor</orth>, <itype>āri, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>benignus</etym>, <sense id="n5194.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to rejoice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take delight</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in operibus ejus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 3</bibl></cit> Esd. 4, 39.</sense></entryFree>
benignus: <entryFree id="n5195" type="main" key="be^nignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnignus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>as if benigenus, from bonus genus, anal. with malignus and privignus</etym>, <sense id="n5195.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a good kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">nature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beneficent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kind.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5195.1" n="I" level="1"> Of feeling or deportment towards others, <hi rend="ital">kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">good</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benignant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam generi lenonio, Numquam ullus deus tam benignus fuit qui fuerit propitius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignus et lepidus et comis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni et benigni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comes, benigni, faciles, suaves homines esse dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apelles in aemulis benignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 88</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">id. praef. § 21: divi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 34 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n5195.2" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">friendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mild</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sociorum comitas vultusque benigni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benigniora verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19, 11</bibl></cit>.—In the jurists, interpretatio, <hi rend="ital">a mild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable interpretation</hi> (opp. dura, which follows the strictness of the letter; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:31 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 10, 31 sq.</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:5:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 5, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper in dubiis benigniora praeferenda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:56" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 50, 17, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignior sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:6:8" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5195.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, = faustus, <hi rend="ital">lucky</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propitious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favorable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:108" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:216" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 10, 216</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5195.4" n="II" level="1"> More freq. of action, <hi rend="ital">beneficent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that gives</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imparts freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bounteous</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">erga te benignus fui, atque opera mea Haec tibi sunt servata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 3, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna ... Nunc mihi, nunc alii benigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui benigniores volunt esse, quam res patitur, peccant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui liberalis benignusque dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:18:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 18, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius in timore benigni quam in victoriā grati reperiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ad Brut. 1, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vini somnique benignus,</quote> <trans><tr>a hard drinker and a lover of sleep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—Opp. to bonae frugi = prodigus, <hi rend="ital">prodigal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lavish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est benignus potius quam bonae frugi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5195.5" n="B" level="2"> Of things (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose; cf. malignus), <hi rend="ital">yielding liberally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fertile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>: et magnas messes terra benigna daret, Tib <pb n="233" /> <cb n="BEO" /> 3, 3, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vepres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egens benignae Tantalus semper dapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenī Benigna vena est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:174" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">benigna materia gratias agendi Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:38:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 38, 6</bibl></cit>: quem (ordinem) persequi longa est magis quam benigna materia, <hi rend="ital">fruitful</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">suitable for exhibition</hi>, Mel. prooem. § 1; <cit><quote lang="la">so Seneca: primus liber .. benigniorem habuit materiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse materiā risūs benignissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 18:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Const. 18, 1</bibl></cit> (cf. also in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/fqonos</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">aestivam sermone benigno tendere noctem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit> (sermone multo et liberali et largo, Lamb.): <cit><quote lang="la">benignissimum inventum, i. e. beneficentissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 11</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnignē</orth> (ante-class. collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnignĭter</orth>). </sense><sense id="n5195.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In a friendly manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benevolently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">benignly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">benigne et amice facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me benignius Omnes salutant quam salutabant prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid ego possiem Blande dicere aut benigne facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam monstrare,</quote> <trans><tr>courteously</tr>, <tr>politely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:16:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 16, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servire alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:76:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 76, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 11, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 4, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites adpellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 96:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 96, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 113:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 113, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alloqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excipere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 35, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 19, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma capere,</quote> <trans><tr>readily</tr>, <tr>willingly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:89" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 89</bibl></cit>.—In the ante-class. form benigniter, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 510, 13</bibl>, and Prisc. p 1010 P.—</sense><sense id="n5195.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Mildly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulgently</hi> (in jurid. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in poenalibus causis benignius interpretandum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:17:155" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 17, 155</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:7:1:section=13" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 44, 7, 1, § 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">benignissime rescripserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5195.8" n="c" level="4"> Benigne dicis, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> benigne, used in colloquial lang. in thanking one for something, both when it is taken and when it is refused (the latter a courtly formula like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ai)nw= se, zhlw= se, kalw=s, ka/llista</foreign>; cf. recte), <hi rend="ital">you are very kind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I thank you very much</hi>, <hi rend="ital">am under great obligation; no</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I thank you.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5195.9" n="(a)" level="5"> In receiving: <hi rend="ital">As.</hi> Peregre cum advenis, cena detur. <hi rend="ital">Di.</hi> Benigne dicis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 9, 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5195.10" n="(b)" level="5"> In declining: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum, inquit, me abs te emere oportet. Optime. Modium denario. Benigne ac liberaliter: nam ego ternis HS non possum vendere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:85:section=196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 85, § 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dic Ad cenam veniat.. Benigne Respondet. Neget ille mihi? etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 16</bibl> Schmid.—</sense><sense id="n5195.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abundantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liberally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 2, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 15, 52</bibl> and 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 32</bibl>. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">benignius Deprome quadrimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulo benignius ipsum Te tractare voles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 11</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5195.12" n="b" level="4"> Benigne facere alicui = bene facere, <hi rend="ital">to do a favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to show favor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 4, 24</bibl> Ruhnk.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:73:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 73, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui plurimis in istā provinciā benigne fecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:67:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 67, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:109" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:39:18" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 39, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:10 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 10 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:page=127" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> p. 127</bibl> Ruhnk. (175 Frotscher).</sense></entryFree>
benjamin: <entryFree id="n5196" type="main" key="Benja^min"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Benjămin</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <sense id="n5196.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The young est son of the Hebrew patriarch Jacob</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 17, 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 12, 1</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:35:18 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 35, 18 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5196.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Jewish tribe of Benjamin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev Chron. 1, 29, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Benjămītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Jews of the tribe of Benjamin</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Chron. 1, 29, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
benna: <entryFree id="n5197" type="gloss" key="benna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">benna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (Gallic), <sense id="n5197.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of carriage;</hi> those who sat in the same benna were called combennones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27</bibl>; cf. Comment. p. 347 (a wagon of wicker or basket-work is still called banne in Belgium, and benne in Switzerland).</sense></entryFree>
bennarius: <entryFree id="n5198" type="gloss" key="benna_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bennārius</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">skhna/rxhs</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
benus: <entryFree id="n5199" type="main" key="be^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. bonus <sense id="n5199.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
beo: <entryFree id="n5200" type="main" key="be^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>akin to benus, bonus, and, acc. to Fick, connected with <foreign lang="greek">deidw, deino/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5200.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bless</hi> (as <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> rare, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for fortuno, beatum efficio; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n5200.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to gladden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rejoice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refresh</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc me beat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foris aliquantillum etiam quod gusto, id beat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid beo te?</quote> <trans><tr>does that gladden thee?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 47</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in colloq. lang. beas or beasti, <hi rend="ital">that delights me</hi>, <hi rend="ital">I am rejoiced at</hi> <cb n="BERE" /> <hi rend="ital">that</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 79</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5200.2" n="II" level="1"> Aliquem aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to make happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reward with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enrich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo Musa beat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu te... bearis Interiore notā Falerni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne dominus Munere te parvo beet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Latium beabit divite linguā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 121</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n5200.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prosperous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blessed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate</hi> (very freq. in prose and poetry; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">felix, fortunatus): neque ulla alia huic verbo, cum beatum dicimus, subjecta notio est, nisi, secretis malis omnibus, cumulata bonorum complexio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:10:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tyrannus ipse judicavit quam esset beatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 20, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui beatus est, non intellego, quid requirat, ut sit beatior: si est enim quod desit, ne beatus quidem est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatus, ni unum hoc desit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 517, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatus ille, qui procul negotiis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:1" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est ab omni Parte beatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatissima vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5200.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">satisne videtur declarasse Dionysius nihil ei esse beatum, cui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>a cause of happiness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:62"
