default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5200.5" n="3" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n5200.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the happy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fortunate persons</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">istam oscitantem sapientiam Scaevolarum et ceterorum beatorum concedamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:33:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 33, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phraaten numero beatorum Eximit Virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5200.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> ( = beatitas, beatitudo, q. v.), <hi rend="ital">happiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blessedness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā sit ipsum etiam beatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:28:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 28, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex bonis, quae sola honesta sunt, efficiendum est beatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:15:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 15, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5200.8" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n5200.9" n="1" level="3"> Of outward prosperity, <hi rend="ital">opulent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wealthy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in good circumstances</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius tyrannus fuit opulentissumae et beatissumae civitatis (sc. Syracusarum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.D. 3, 33, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res omnes quibus abundant ii, qui beati putantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 37, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eorum ornatus... hominis non beatissimi suspicionem prae, beret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7, 3</bibl>; 3, 16, 32; 3, 29, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2</bibl>-8, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 15, 34</bibl>.— As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕāti</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the rich</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noli nobilibus, noli conferre beatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:33" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5200.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excellent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">magnificent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gazae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cyprus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 26, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> C.S. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>.—With <case>abl.</case>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:12:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 14</bibl>: argentum felix omnique beatius auro, Ov P 2, 8, 5.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubertas,</quote> <trans><tr>overflowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:109" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5200.11" n="2" level="3"> Late Lat., <hi rend="ital">blessed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">deceased</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem cum beatum fuisse Sallustius respondisset, intellexit occisum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">beatae memoriae,</quote> <trans><tr>of blessed memory</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. ad Marc. 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: si nobis, cum ex hac vitā emigraverimus, in beatorum insulis inmortale aevum, ut fabulae ferunt, degere liceret, Cic. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 14:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 14, 9</bibl> (Fragm. Hortens. 40 B. and K.).—</sense><sense id="n5200.12" n="3" level="3"> Beatissimus, in late Lat., <hi rend="ital">a title of the higher clergy</hi>, Cod. 1, 4, 13; Auct. Collat. 9, 6; Novell. 123, 3 al. —Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">happily</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par 1, 3, 15</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Helv. 9:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. Helv. 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
berber: <entryFree id="n5201" type="main" key="berber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">berber</orth>, perh. old <sense id="n5201.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, = fervere, Carm. Frat. Arv.</sense></entryFree>
berbex: <entryFree id="n5202" type="main" key="berbex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">berbex</orth>, v. vervex.</entryFree>
bercorcates: <entryFree id="n5203" type="main" key="Bercorca_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bercorcātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5203.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Gallia Aquitanica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
berecyntus: <entryFree id="n5204" type="main" key="Be^re^cyntus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕcyntus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bere/kuntos</foreign>, <sense id="n5204.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain on the banks of the river Sangarius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Phrygia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sacred to Cybele</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 784</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 82</bibl>; Schol. Cruq. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 22</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5204.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv., the <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5204.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕcyntĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕcynth-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bereku/ntios</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n5204.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the mountain Berecyntus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Berecyntian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 29, 29, § 108</bibl></cit> (acc. to Pliny, in Caria): juga, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 300</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 785</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:782" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 782</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕcyntia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:355" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 355</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5204.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cybele</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Midas</tr>, <tr>son of Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attis,</quote> <trans><tr>her favorite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:93" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 93</bibl></cit>: tibia, <hi rend="ital">a flute of a crooked shape</hi> (orig. employed only in her festivals), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:181" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 181</bibl>; hence, for <hi rend="ital">a curved Phrygian flute</hi>, in gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 22</bibl>; Ov M. 11, 16; cf. <cb n="BERU" /> cornu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 18, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">furores,</quote> <trans><tr>the madness of the priests of Cybele</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:43:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 43, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5204.5" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕcyntĭădes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">Berecyntian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venator, perh. Attis (v. Attis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:506" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 506</bibl></cit> Heins.—</sense><sense id="n5204.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕcyntĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = Berecyntius, 2., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Cybele</hi>: sacerdos, Prud. c. Sym. 2, 51.</sense></entryFree>
beregrani: <entryFree id="n5205" type="main" key="Bere_^gra_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Berē^grāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5205.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the people of Beregria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a town in Picenum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
berelides: <entryFree id="n5206" type="main" key="Be^re^li^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕlĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5206.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a group of small islands off the southern coast of Sardima</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 7, 13, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
berenice: <entryFree id="n5207" type="main" key="Be^re^ni_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕnīcē</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrŏnīcē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bereni/kh</foreign>. <sense id="n5207.0" n="I" level="1"> A female name. </sense><sense id="n5207.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Ptolemy Philadelphus and Arsinoë</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of her own brother</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ptolemy Euergetes; her beautiful hair was placed as a constellation in heaven</hi> (Coma or Crinis Berenices), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:24" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 24</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the poem of Catullus: de Coma Berenices, 66, 1 sqq. (Another constellation of the same name,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 70, 71, § 178</bibl></cit>.)—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5207.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕnīcēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Berenice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5207.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of the Jewish king Agrippa I.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accused of incest</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:156" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 156</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called uxor Titi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 10:4" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 10, 4</bibl></cit>; called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bernīcē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 25, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5207.4" n="II" level="1"> The name of several towns. </sense><sense id="n5207.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">In Cyrenaica</hi>, earlier called <hi rend="ital">Hesperis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Benghazi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 5, 5, § 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 54</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 16, 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5207.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrĕnīcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the region around Berenice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:249" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 249</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3880</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5207.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5207.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the Red Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 70</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5207.9" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the frontier of Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:168" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 29, 33, § 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bergae: <entryFree id="n5208" type="main" key="Bergae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bergae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5208.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Scythia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:5:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:6:9" default="NO">3, 6, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bergi: <entryFree id="n5209" type="main" key="Bergi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bergi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5209.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the North Sea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bergimus: <entryFree id="n5210" type="gloss" key="Bergi^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bergĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5210.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deity of the</hi> Galli Cenomani, <hi rend="ital">in Upper Italy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1971 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2194</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bergistani: <entryFree id="n5211" type="main" key="Bergista_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bergistāni</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vergistāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5211.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a community of robbers in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 16, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 17, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 21, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bergomum: <entryFree id="n5212" type="main" key="Bergo^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bergŏmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*be/rgomon</foreign>, <sense id="n5212.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Gallia Transpadana, now <hi rend="ital">Bergamo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 65</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bergŏmas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bergomum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">MVNICIPIVM,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">RESPVBLICA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3898</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bergomātes</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Bergomum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 1, 2, § 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Orig. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bernice: <entryFree id="n5213" type="main" key="Berni_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bernīcē</orth>, <itype>es</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Berenice, I. B.</entryFree>
beroe: <entryFree id="n5214" type="main" key="Be^ro^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bero/h</foreign>. <sense id="n5214.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The nurse of Semele</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 278</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 167" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 167</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5214.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Oceanids</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 341</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5214.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Doryclus of Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 620</bibl> Wagn.</sense></entryFree>
beroea: <entryFree id="n5215" type="main" key="Be^roea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕroea</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Berrh-</orth>) (trisyl.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*be/roia (*be/rroia</foreign>), <sense id="n5215.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Macedonia</hi>, later called <hi rend="ital">Irenopolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north of the river Aliacmon</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Verria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45, 2</bibl> and 5; 45, 29, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕroeaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Berœan</hi>, Liv 23, 39, 3 (al. Boeotius); 42, 58, 7; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Beroeenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Berœans</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 82</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
berones: <entryFree id="n5216" type="main" key="Be_ro_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bērōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bh/rwnes</foreign>, acc. to Strab. 3, p. 238, <sense id="n5216.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a powerful people in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Fragm. 91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Fragm. 91</bibl>, lin. 213 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">perhaps there is a reference to these Berones in the obscure passage,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Alex. 53" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Alex. 53</bibl></cit>: semper enim Berones, etc. (perh. a body-guard of Berones; perh. also kindr. with the Gallic baro, acc. to the Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:138" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 138</bibl>: lingua Gallica barones vel varones dicuntur servi militum).</sense></entryFree>
beronice: <entryFree id="n5217" type="main" key="Be^ro^ni_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕrŏnīcē</orth>, v. Berenice.</entryFree>
berosus: <entryFree id="n5218" type="main" key="Be_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bērōsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bhrwsso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5218.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished Babylonian astrologer of the time of Ptolemy Philadelphus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1</bibl>, (4); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:29:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 37, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:160" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 49, 50, § 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
berresa: <entryFree id="n5219" type="main" key="Berresa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Berresa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5219.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Ethiopia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 50, § 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
berrice: <entryFree id="n5220" type="main" key="Berri^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Berrĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5220.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a large island north of Europe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 16, 30, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
berula: <entryFree id="n5221" type="main" key="beru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">berŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5221.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> cardamine, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 36</bibl>. <pb n="234" /> <cb n="BESS" /></sense></entryFree>
beryllus: <entryFree id="n5222" type="greek" key="be_ryllus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēryllus</orth> (beryllus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 855</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">bērillus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 7, 5</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">berul-lus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl> Jan.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bh/rullos</foreign>. <sense id="n5222.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone of a sea-green color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coming from India</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beryl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl> sqq.; Isid. Orig. l. l.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:4:16:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 4, 16, § 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5222.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">a ring with a beryl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 7, 9.—</sense><sense id="n5222.2" n="II" level="1"> Beryllus aëroides, = <foreign lang="greek">bh/rullos a)eroeidh/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the sapphire</hi>, Plin. l. l. § 77.</sense></entryFree>
berytus: <entryFree id="n5223" type="main" key="Be_ry_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bērȳtus</orth> (Bērytus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Descr. Orb. Terr. 1080</bibl>; cf. Wernsdorf <usg type="style">poet.</usg> Lat. Min. V. p. 1103), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bhru=to/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5223.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seaport town of Phœnicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for its excellent wine; as a Roman colony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called</hi> Felix Julia, now <hi rend="ital">Beirout</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 17, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:15:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 15, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Perieg. p. 853</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5223.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5223.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bērȳtĭus</orth> (Bērytĭus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Praef. ad Syagr. 20</bibl>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Berytus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 7, 9, § 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 15, 17, 18, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5223.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bērȳtensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Berytensian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Berytus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 15, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bērȳtenses</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Berytus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1246</bibl>; Cod. 1, 17, 2, § 9.</sense></entryFree>
bes: <entryFree id="n5224" type="main" key="bes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bes</orth>, <itype>bessis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<case>nom.</case> bessis, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=33" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 33</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Ponder. p. 1348</bibl> P.) [be-is = binae partes assis]. <sense id="n5224.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Two thirds of a unit</hi> (the as); <hi rend="ital">eight</hi> unciae, or <hi rend="ital">twelfths</hi> (cf. as): bessis octo sunt unciae (8/12 = 2/3), triens quattuor, Paul. ex Fest. l. l. </sense><sense id="n5224.1" n="A" level="2"> As a coin: fenus ex triente Idib. Quint. factum erat bessibus, i. e. instead of the previous monthly interest of 1/3 %, 2/3 % was now reckoned; thus, acc. to the present mode of calculating, for the year, the interest advanced from 4 % (12X1/3) to 8 % (12X2/3), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5224.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">two thirds</hi> of any whole. </sense><sense id="n5224.3" n="1" level="3"> Of shares in a partnership: <cit><quote lang="la">Nerva constituit, ut tu ex triente socius esses, ego ex besse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:76" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5224.4" n="2" level="3"> Of a sum of money: <cit><quote lang="la">exsolvere bessem pretii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 1, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5224.5" n="3" level="3"> Of a tract of land: <cit><quote lang="la">emere bessem fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:21:2:section=39" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 16, 21, 2, § 39</bibl></cit>: bisque novem, Nemeaee, dabis, bessemque (i. e. <hi rend="ital">eight months</hi>) sub illis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 367</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5224.6" n="4" level="3"> Of a jugerum: <cit><quote lang="la">partes duae tertiae pedes decem novem milia et ducentos, hoc est bes, in quo sunt scripula CXCII.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5224.7" n="5" level="3"> Of a measure of capacity: <cit><quote lang="la">bes sextarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 126" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 126</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5224.8" n="6" level="3"> Of a pound, = 8 <hi rend="ital">ounces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in binos semodios farinae satis esse bessem fermenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 26, § 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 157" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 157</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5224.9" n="7" level="3"> Of an inheritance: <cit><quote lang="la">heres ex besse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 24, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5224.10" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">eight</hi>: quincunces et sex cyathos bessemque bibamus, Caïus ut fiat Julius et Proculus (i. e. <hi rend="ital">so many letters were comprised in these names;</hi> cf. 1. bibo, 2. e.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:36:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 36, 7</bibl> and 8.—</sense><sense id="n5224.11" n="D" level="2"> Bes alter = (12+8)/12 = 1 2/3, Fest. s. v. triens, p. 363 Müll.—</sense><sense id="n5224.12" n="II" level="1"> In mathematics, where the cardinal number is six (cf. <hi rend="ital">as</hi> !*?), bes = 4, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di/moiros</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1, p. 61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, p. 61</bibl> Rod. and bes alter = (6+4)/6 = 1 2/3, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)pidi/moiros</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
besa: <entryFree id="n5225" type="main" key="Be_sa_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bēsā</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bhsa=</foreign>, <sense id="n5225.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian divinity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
besaro: <entryFree id="n5226" type="main" key="Besaro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Besaro</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5226.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Spain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
besbicus: <entryFree id="n5227" type="main" key="Besbicus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Besbicus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5227.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Propontis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 88, 90, § 204</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:151" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 32, 44, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
besidiae: <entryFree id="n5228" type="main" key="Besi^di^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Besĭdĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5228.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Bruttium</hi>, perh. the present <hi rend="ital">Bisignano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 19, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bessalis: <entryFree id="n5229" type="main" key="bessa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bessālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bes</etym>, <sense id="n5229.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">comprising eight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterculus,</quote> <trans><tr>a tile eight inches long</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:71:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 71, 7</bibl></cit>: clausulae, Porphyr. prooem. ad Hor. Epod.— </sense><sense id="n5229.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">any thing of small value</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 58, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bessi: <entryFree id="n5230" type="main" key="Bessi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bessi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*be/ssoi</foreign>, Strab.; <foreign lang="greek">*bhssoi/</foreign>, Herod., <sense id="n5230.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a savage and marauding people in the north-eastern part of Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about the Hœmus mountains</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and in the vicinity of the Hebrus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 2, 91</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bessus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3548</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3552</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bessĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Bessi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bessus: <entryFree id="n5231" type="main" key="Bessus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bessus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n5231.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Bessian;</hi> v. Bessi. —</sense><sense id="n5231.1" n="II" level="1"> <foreign lang="greek">*bh=ssos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a viceroy of Bactria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the murderer<cb n="BEST" />  of Darius Codomannus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:8:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:9:2" default="NO">5, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:5:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 5, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bestia: <entryFree id="n5232" type="main" key="besti^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bestĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perh. akin to fera and to belua</etym>, <sense id="n5232.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a beast</hi> (as a being without reason; opp. to man; while animal, = aliving being, includes man; bestia includes both fera, the beast as distinguished by fierceness, and belua, as distinguished by its size or ferocity; cf. Doed. Syn. 4, p. 290 sq.). </sense><sense id="n5232.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5232.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (in the classical per. mostly in prose; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Cic., who uses it in its most extended signif., of every kind of living creature excepting man): disserens, neque in homine inesse animum vel animam nec in bestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 11, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si hoc apparet in bestiis volucribus, nantibus, agrestibus, cicuribus, feris... quanto id magis in homine fit natura, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:48:124" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 48, 124</bibl>.—So of the serpent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 75</bibl>.—Of the crocodile and other amphibious animals, Cic. l. l.—Of the dog, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl>. —Of the elephant (for the more usual belua), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 9, 7</bibl>.—Of the ass, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl>.—Of a caterpillar, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 62</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the ostrich: sequitur natura avium, quarum grandissimi et paene bestiarum generis struthiocameli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:1:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 1, 1, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:1:section=10" default="NO">9, 1, 1, § 10</bibl>.—With muta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 21, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 4, 6</bibl> (cf. mutae pecudes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 8, 24</bibl>).—And for the designation of a wild animal, with fera: <cit><quote lang="la">vinctum ante se Thyum agebat, ut si feram bestiam captam duceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 3, 2</bibl></cit> Dähne; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 27, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 19, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 2:1:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 2, 1, 12 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n5232.3" n="2" level="3"> As a term of reproach (cf. belua and our beast): <cit><quote lang="la">mala tu es bestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 13</bibl>.—And, humorously, of the odor of the armpits (cf. ala and caper), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:69:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 69, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5232.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., when the contest with animals became more usual in the public spectacles at Rome (not yet customary A.U.C. 583, B.C. 171, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 9, 4</bibl>), bestia designated, without the addition of fera, <hi rend="ital">a wild beast destined to fight with gladiators</hi> or <hi rend="ital">criminals</hi> (v. bestiarius; <cit><quote lang="la">usually lions, tigers, panthers, etc.).—Hence, ad bestias mittere aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to send one to fight with wild beasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl></cit>; so, bestiis obioere aliquem, Asin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 32, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">condemnare aliquem ad bestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare aliquem ad bestias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:14:27" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 14, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pugnam bestiarum datus, Gell. l. l. § 10: tradere aliquem ad bestias depugnandas, Dig. l. l.: bestiarum damnatio,</quote> <trans><tr>the condemnation to fight with wild beasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:48:13:6 al" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 13, 6 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence the expl.: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiarum vocabulum proprie convenit leonibus, pardis et lupis, tigribus et vulpibus, canibus et simiis ac ceteris, quae vel ore vel unguibus saeviunt, exceptis serpentibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 2, 1</bibl></cit> (but cf. supra, 1.).—</sense><sense id="n5232.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a constellation, <hi rend="ital">the wotf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl> (7) (called by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=211" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 211</bibl> or 455, Quadrupes vasta).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5233" type="main" key="Besti^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bestĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5233.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen in the Calpurnian family.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5233.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The consul</hi> L. Calpurnius Bestia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27, 4 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5233.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The tribune of the people</hi> L. Bestia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:128" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 34, 128</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 283</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5233.3" n="III" level="1"> Another <hi rend="ital">tribune of the people</hi>, L. Bestia, <hi rend="ital">a confederate of Catiline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bestialis: <entryFree id="n5234" type="main" key="besti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bestĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bestia</etym>, <sense id="n5234.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">like a beast</hi> (post-class. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">villi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 153</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fierce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bestiarius: <entryFree id="n5235" type="main" key="besti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bestĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id. I. B.</etym>, <sense id="n5235.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to beasts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus,</quote> <trans><tr>a fight with beasts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:70:22" default="NO">70, 22</bibl>.—Usu. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bestĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who fights with wild beasts in the public spectacles</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a beast-fighter</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">qhrioma/xhs</foreign> (persons hired, or criminals: the former with weapons, and as victors rewarded; <cit><quote lang="la">the latter, unarmed, and sometimes bound,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pud. 22</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">praeclara aedilitas! Unus leo, ducenti bestiarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:64:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 64, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatoribus et bestiariis obsedere rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:17:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 17, 40</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:19:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 19, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludus bestiariorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 17</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bestiola: <entryFree id="n5236" type="main" key="besti^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bestĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>bestia</etym>, <sense id="n5236.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small animal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little beast</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N.D. 2, 48, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:39:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 39, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 70:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 70, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 6, 7, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:156" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 17, 44, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:163" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 81, § 163</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> R. R. 3, 15, 10 al.</bibl> <cb n="BIBA" /></sense></entryFree>
bestius: <entryFree id="n5237" type="main" key="Besti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bestĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bestia</etym>, <sense id="n5237.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rough and miserly man</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:37" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
beta: <entryFree id="n5238" type="main" key="be_ta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bētis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 54, 9</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>hence Fr. bette; Engl. beet</etym>, <sense id="n5238.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vegetable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the beet</hi>: Beta vulgaris, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 40, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:69" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 8, 27, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:254" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 254</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:326" default="NO">10, 326</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:17" default="NO">11, 3, 17</bibl> and 42; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 10</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 26</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 26, 2</bibl>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:47:9" default="NO">3, 47, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 10, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5239" type="greek" key="be_ta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēta</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype> (beta, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Aus. Technopaegn. c. Litt. Mon. v. 13), = <foreign lang="greek">bh=ta</foreign>, <sense id="n5239.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Greek name of the second letter of the alphabet</hi> (pure Lat. be; v. B): hoc discunt omnes ante alpha et beta puellae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:209" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 209</bibl>.—Hence, prov., <hi rend="ital">the second in any thing</hi> (as alpha is the first), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
betaceus: <entryFree id="n5240" type="main" key="be_ta_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bētācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. beta</etym>, <sense id="n5240.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from</hi> or <hi rend="ital">of the beet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes betacei,</quote> <trans><tr>beet-roots</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bētācĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. pes), <hi rend="ital">beet-root</hi> (cf. Charis. pp. 24 and 128 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 618</bibl> ib.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 2</bibl> (where others, less correctly, read Baeticae); <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 133</bibl> (others, betis).</sense></entryFree>
betasi: <entryFree id="n5241" type="main" key="Beta_si"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Betāsi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5241.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Belgian people</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 17, 31, § 106</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 56</bibl> and 66.</sense></entryFree>
bethlehem: <entryFree id="n5242" type="main" key="Be_^thle^hem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bē^thlĕhem, Bē^thleëm, Bē^th-lem</orth>, <gen>n.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bē^thlĕhēmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign />, <sense id="n5242.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the tribe of Judah</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of David and of Christ</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Beit el Lahm;</hi> form Bethlehem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:35:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 35, 19</bibl>.—Form Bethleem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 153</bibl>; scanned Bĕthlēēm, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 737.—Form Bethlem, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 78</bibl>.—Form Bethlehemum, Hier. Vit. Paulae.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5242.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bē^thlaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bethlehem</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Carm. 2, 73</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5242.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bē^thlĕĕmĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bethlehem</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 260</bibl> dub.—</sense><sense id="n5242.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bē^thlĕhĕmītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Bethlehem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Bethlehemite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 16, 1</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n5242.4" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bē^thlĕmĭtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Bethlehem</hi>, Hier. Vit. Paulae.</sense></entryFree>
betis: <entryFree id="n5243" type="main" key="be_tis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bētis</orth>, v. 1. beta.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n5244" type="main" key="Be_tis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bētis</orth>, v. Baetis.</entryFree>
betizare: <entryFree id="n5245" type="hapax" key="be_ti_zare"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bētīzare</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">bētissare</orth>), <itype>used by Augustus for languere</itype> <etym>on account of the softness of the beet, 1. beta; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 21</bibl>: languidior tenera beta</etym>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl> Ruhnk.</entryFree>
beto: <entryFree id="n5246" type="main" key="be_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bēto</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">baeto</orth>; in Plaut. <orth extent="full" lang="la">bīto</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>kindr. with vado and <foreign lang="greek">bai/nw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n5246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go</hi> (with its derivatives, abito, adbito, ebito, interbito, perbito, praeterbito, rebito, bitienses, only ante-class.): in pugnam baetite, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 77, 21</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 255 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">si ire conor, prohibet betere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Varr. ib.: ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad portum ne bitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
betriacum: <entryFree id="n5247" type="main" key="Betriacum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Betriacum</orth>, v. Bedriacum.</entryFree>
betucius: <entryFree id="n5248" type="main" key="Betuci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Betucĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, e. g. T. Betucius Bassus, <hi rend="ital">an orator of</hi> Asculum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 46</bibl>. 169.</sense></entryFree>
betula: <entryFree id="n5249" type="main" key="betu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">betŭla</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">betulla</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the birch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 18, 30, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:176" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 37, 69, § 176</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
betulus: <entryFree id="n5250" type="main" key="betu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">betŭlus</orth>, v. baetulus.</entryFree>
biaeothanatus: <entryFree id="n5251" type="greek" key="bi^aeo^tha^na^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭaeŏthănătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">biaioqa/natos</foreign>, <sense id="n5251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dying by violence</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bianor: <entryFree id="n5252" type="main" key="Bi^a_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭānor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">bi/a-a)nh/r</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n5252.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A centaur slain by Theseus at the marriage festival of Pirithŏus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 345</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5252.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An ancient hero of Mantua</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 60</bibl>; acc. to Serv. in h. l. and upon A. 10, 198-200, <hi rend="ital">the founder of Mantua</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and identical with Ocnus.</hi></sense></entryFree>
biarchia: <entryFree id="n5253" type="greek" key="bi^archi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭarchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">biarxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of a</hi> biarchus, <hi rend="ital">a commissaryship</hi>, Cod. Const. 1, 31, 1.</sense></entryFree>
biarchus: <entryFree id="n5254" type="greek" key="bi^archus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bi/arxos</foreign>, <sense id="n5254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a commissary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superintendent of provisions</hi>, Hier. adv. Joann. Hieros. n. 19; Imp. Leo Cod. 14, 20, 3.</sense></entryFree>
bias: <entryFree id="n5255" type="main" key="Bi^a_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭās</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n5255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek philosopher of Priene</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the seven wise men of Greece</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl>, ext. 3.</sense></entryFree>
bibaculus: <entryFree id="n5256" type="main" key="Bi^ba_cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭbācŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bibax</etym>, <sense id="n5256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen;</hi> e. g. of the poet M. Furius; <cit><quote lang="la">of the prætor L. Furius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bibaga: <entryFree id="n5257" type="main" key="Bibaga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bibaga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island near Gedrosia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 21, 23, § 80</bibl>. <pb n="235" /> <cb n="BIBO" /></sense></entryFree>
bibali: <entryFree id="n5258" type="main" key="Bibali"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bibali</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bibax: <entryFree id="n5259" type="main" key="bi^bax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bibo</etym>, <sense id="n5259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">given to drink</hi>, Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biber: <entryFree id="n5260" type="main" key="bi^ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭber</orth>, v. bibo <sense id="n5260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
biberius: <entryFree id="n5261" type="main" key="Bi^be^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭbĕrĭus Caldius Mero [</orth>bibocalidus-merum], <sense id="n5261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name given in derision to the emperor Tiberius Claudius Nero on account of his love of drink</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bibesia: <entryFree id="n5262" type="gloss" key="Bi^be^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭbĕsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Drinkland</hi>, a comically formed name, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Perediam et Bibesiam Plautus finxit suā consuetudine, cum intellegi voluit cupiditatem edendi et bibendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=214:28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 214, 28</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. Peredia.</sense></entryFree>
bibilis: <entryFree id="n5263" type="hapax" key="bi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bibo</etym>, <sense id="n5263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drinkable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">potable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:11:81" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 11, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bibio: <entryFree id="n5264" type="main" key="bi^bi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5264.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small insect generated in wine</hi>, = mustio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 8, 16</bibl>; v. 2. bibo.—</sense><sense id="n5264.1" n="II" level="1"> = vipio, q. v.</sense></entryFree>
bibitor: <entryFree id="n5265" type="hapax" key="bi^bi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">toper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bibitus: <entryFree id="n5266" type="main" key="bi^bi^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from bibo.</entryFree>
biblia: <entryFree id="n5267" type="main" key="bibli^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biblĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bibli/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Bible</hi>, eccl. Lat.; and very late, <orth extent="full" lang="la">biblĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen></sense></entryFree>
biblinus: <entryFree id="n5268" type="greek" key="bibli^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biblĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">bi/blinos (bu/blinos</foreign>), <sense id="n5268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">made from the Egyptian papyrus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 51</bibl></cit>, n. 1.</sense></entryFree>
bibliopola: <entryFree id="n5269" type="greek" key="bibli^o^po_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biblĭŏpōla</orth> (BYBLIOPOLA, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4154</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bibliopw/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n5269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bookseller</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:72" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 14, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
bibliotheca: <entryFree id="n5270" type="greek" key="bibli^o^the_ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biblĭŏthēca</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">bī^blĭŏthēcē</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:77:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 77, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 584</bibl>; <sense id="n5270.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and BYBL-,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1172</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">biblioqh/kh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a library;</hi> and, as in Greek and English, both <hi rend="ital">a library-room and a collection of books</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=28" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 28</bibl>. The expl. of Isidorus applies to the first signif.: bibliotheca est locus, ubi reponuntur libri, <foreign lang="greek">bi/blos</foreign> enim Graece liber, <foreign lang="greek">qh/kh</foreign> repositorium dicitur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 15, 5, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 9, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 3, 1. The first public library at Rome was collected by Asinius Pollio A.U.C. 715, B.C. 39, in the atrium of the Temple of Liberty,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 30, 31, § 115</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:10" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 2, 2, § 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:71" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 4</bibl>. Augustus founded two others, the Octavian, named after his sister Octavia, A.U.C. 721, B.C. 33, near the Theatre of Marcellus, Plut. Vit. Marcell.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:60" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 60</bibl> and 69 Jahn; <cit><quote lang="la">and five years after, the Palatine (Gr. and Lat.) Library, on the Palatine Hill, in the Temple of Apollo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>; Dio, 53, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 40</bibl> and 41. Besides these there were other considerable libraries in Rome, e. g. in the Temple of Peace, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 8, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the house of Tiberius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">but esp. one founded by Trajan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 17</bibl></cit>, and united by Diocletian with his Thermis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Prob. 2</bibl>. Individuals also possessed large libraries, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 28, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:44:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 44, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:104" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:57" default="NO">10, 1, 57</bibl>; Plut. Lucull.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 56</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. at their country-seats,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:7:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 7, 8 al.</bibl>—The books were arranged in cases or on shelves along the walls (armaria, foruli, loculamenta, capsae).—<hi rend="ital">The librarian</hi>, or person who had the charge of the books, was called <hi rend="ital">a bibliothecā</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 40</bibl> and 41, or <hi rend="ital">bibliothecarius</hi>, v. Dict. of Antiq.</sense></entryFree>
bibliothecalis: <entryFree id="n5271" type="main" key="bibli^o^the_ca_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biblĭŏthēcālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bibliotheca</etym>, <sense id="n5271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a library</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">thesaurus,</quote> <trans><tr>a repository of books</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 139</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bibliothecarius: <entryFree id="n5272" type="main" key="bibli^o^the_ca_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biblĭŏthēcārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a librarian</hi> (late Lat.), M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 5</bibl>: bibliothecarius qui codices servat, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
bibliothecula: <entryFree id="n5273" type="hapax" key="bibli^o^the_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biblĭŏthēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small library</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a collection of books</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:18" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biblus: <entryFree id="n5274" type="greek" key="biblus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biblus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bi/blos (bu/blos</foreign>), <sense id="n5274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the papyrus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sort of rush that grew largely in Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the inner bark of which paper was made</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for the more usual papyrus): <cit><quote lang="la">flumineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 222</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:71 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 22, § 71 sq.</bibl>—<usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">paper</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bibo: <entryFree id="n5275" type="main" key="bi^bo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbo</orth>, <itype>bĭbi</itype> (post-class. <sense id="n5275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. fut.</hi> bĭbĭtūrus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Isa. 8, 25, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:20:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 20, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 23, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 1</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> bĭbĭtus, a, um, Cael. Aur. <cb n="BIBO" /> Chron. 4, 3, 60; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 5, 3</bibl>; Aem. Mac. c. de Porro; <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> apocop. biber, Cato, Titin., and Fannii Annal. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 99</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root bi; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pi-, pi/nw, pe/pwka</foreign>; whence Lat. poto, as if from po; Sanscr. pī; Slav. piti; Lith. pota</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to drink</hi> (usually from thirst, a natural want; poto, to drink from passion, habit, etc.; but poto is occasionally used of water, etc., e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 68, § 179</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bibere naturae est, potare luxuriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Diff. 1</bibl></cit>. 74; and the <hi rend="ital">partt.</hi> potus and potatus are regularly used instead of the <hi rend="ital">partt.</hi> of bibo). </sense><sense id="n5275.1" n="I" level="1"> With <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n5275.2" n="1" level="3"> Of the liquid drunk: <cit><quote lang="la">per aestatem boves aquam bonam et liquidam bibant semper curato,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunus heminam bibito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si voles vinum Choum bibere, licebit bibas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 48</bibl></cit>: eapse merum condidicit bibere; <cit><quote lang="la">foribus dat aquam quam bibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicit vinum quod bibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Darius in fugā cum aquam turbidam bibisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrono malo suadebat ut mulsum frigidum biberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:70:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 70, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viveret, nisi illud (i. e. venenum) bibisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibo aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur apud te vinum aetate tuā vetustius bibitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 17:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi Hy. mettia mella Falerno Ne biberis diluta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Veientani bibitur faex crassa rubelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:103:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 103, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lac bibere,</quote> <trans><tr>to suck</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 377</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 615</bibl>.—Also nutricem bibere (i. e. lac de nutrice), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 115, 29</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">Caecubam... Tu bibes uvam (i. e. vinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 20, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in usu radix tantum duabus drachmis bibenda (i. e. sucus radicis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 30, § 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.3" n="2" level="3"> Pocula or cyathos bibere. </sense><sense id="n5275.4" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, = vinum (cf. <foreign lang="greek">pi/nein krath=ras</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">tristia cum multo pocula felle bibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:50" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse bibebam Sobria suppositā pocula victor aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura pocula = plus vini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 9, 59</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nomismata and aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:26:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 26, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.5" n="(b)" level="5"> Of the number of cups drunk at a merry-making: vide quot cyathos bibimus: <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Tot quot digiti sunt tibi in manu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 24</bibl>.—Esp. of the custom of drinking names, i. e. as many cups as there are letters in a name proposed; the number is frequently expressed by fractional parts of the as (uncia = a cyathus; <cit><quote lang="la">quincunx = 5 cyathi, etc.): quincunces et sex cyathos bessemque bibamus, Gaius ut fiat, Julius, et Proculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:36:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 36, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebros ergo licet bibas trientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:106:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 106, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diluti bibis unciam Falerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:v. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> v. 3</bibl></cit> (cf. with potare: <cit><quote lang="la">sextantes et deunces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 28</bibl></cit>).—Hence, nomen bibere, Julium, etc., bibere: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jugulem curas, nomen utrumque bibam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:57:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 57,
