26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laevia sex cyathis, septem Justina bibatur, Quinque Lycas, Lyde quattuor, Ida tribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:71:1 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 71, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Astyanacta bibes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.6" n="3" level="3"> Fluvium, undam, pruinas bibere (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n5275.7" n="(a)" level="5"> = aquam ex flumine bibere: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam Pabula gustassent Trojae Xanthumque bibissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam crassus torrens bibitur tamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:821" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 821</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puram bibis amnibus undam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Herc. 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to arrive at the region of the river</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non illum nostri possunt mutare labores, Nec si... Hebrumque bibamus Sithoniasque nives... subeamus (i. e. si Thraciam adeamus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante... Aut Ararim Parthus bibet, aut Germania Tigrim Quam, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>sooner will the Parthians come to Germany</tr>, <tr>or the Germans to the country of the Parthians</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbaque Phasiacam Graia bibistis aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5275.9" n="(g)" level="5"> Qui flumen bibunt, = <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the country through which the river passes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Tiberim Fabarimque bibunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui profundum Danubium bibunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:15:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 15, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui Nilum ex ipso protinus ore bibunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:88:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 88, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populosque bibentes Euphraten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui te, Nile, bibit, Claud. Prob. et Olybr. 38.—So of an inland sea: caesamque bibens Maeotin Alanus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 812</bibl></cit>.—Of a single person: <cit><quote lang="la">extremum Tanaim si biberes, Lyce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—Similarly, montium pruinas bibere, of the rivers fed by a mountain range: <cit><quote lang="la">amniumque... quicunque Odrysias bibunt pruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: fluvios qui... Alpinasque bibunt de more pruinas, Claud. Prob. et Olybr. 255.—</sense><sense id="n5275.10" n="4" level="3"> Bibere aquas, <hi rend="ital">to be drowned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu bibat aequoreas naufragus hostis aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 62</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of ships, <hi rend="ital">to founder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be wrecked</hi>: o utinam...<cb n="BIBO" />  Argo funestas pressa bibisset aquas! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.11" n="5" level="3"> Sanguinem or cruorem bibere. </sense><sense id="n5275.12" n="(a)" level="5"> Sanguinem, in a figurative sense, = sanguinem sitire: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus sanguinem (Antonium) non bibere censeatis? (sitire, animo bibere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.13" n="(b)" level="5"> Cruorem bibere, <hi rend="ital">to draw blood</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kill</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hasta virgineum alte bibit acta cruorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 803</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 78</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5275.14" n="6" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to things other than liquids. </sense><sense id="n5275.15" n="a" level="4"> Of concrete things: dixit et ardentes avido bibit ore favillas, <hi rend="ital">breathed in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drew in</hi> (of the sparks of a funeral pyre), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:42:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 42, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilandae noctes et fuligo lucubrationum bibenda,</quote> <trans><tr>inhale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5275.16" n="b" level="4"> Figuratively, of abstract things. </sense><sense id="n5275.17" n="(a)" level="5"> = cupideaudire, legere: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnas et exactos tyrannos... bibit aure vulgus,</quote> <trans><tr>eagerly listens to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipe: suspensis auribus ista bibam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:4:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: hinc ille justitiae haustus bibat, <hi rend="ital">imbibe</hi> (by reading) the love of justice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 31</bibl>: illa divino fruitur sermone parentis, maternosque bibit mores, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 231.—</sense><sense id="n5275.18" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To imbibe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be affected with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix Dido, longumque bibebat amorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:749" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 749</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totisque novum bibit ossibus ignem,</quote> <trans><tr>the fire of love</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 303</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5275.19" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To draw out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exhaust</hi>: nudae illae artes omnem sucum ingenii bibunt, Quint. prooem. 24.—</sense><sense id="n5275.20" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To swallow</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">forget</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam ego vinum bibo, mandata hau consuevi simul bibere una,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5275.21" n="7" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. subjects, <hi rend="ital">to absorb liquids</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imbibe them</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id si feceris metreta oleum non bibet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 100</bibl></cit>. —So trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">claudite jam rivos... sat prata biberunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inriguumque bibant violaria fontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (terra) bibit humorem,</quote> <trans><tr>absorbs moisture</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amphora fumum bibere instituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mista bibunt molles lacrimis unguenta favillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:561" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc bibit irriguus fertilis hortus aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanarum nigrae nullum colorem bibunt,</quote> <trans><tr>take no color</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 193</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">candorem (i. e. colorem candidum) bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 11, 47, § 123</bibl></cit>: arcus bibit (aquas) and nubes bibunt (aquas), <hi rend="ital">the rainbow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the clouds draw water</hi> (according to a popular belief among the ancients): <cit><quote lang="la">cur bibit arcus aquas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5</bibl></cit> (4, 4), 32: <cit><quote lang="la">et bibit ingens Arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:380" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 380</bibl></cit>.—And, jestingly, of an old woman given to drink: ecce autem, bibit arcus; <cit><quote lang="la">hercle, credo, hodie pluet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 39</bibl></cit> (44): <cit><quote lang="la">unde aures nubesque bibunt atque imbrifer arcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:405" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 405</bibl></cit>.—So with object understood: <cit><quote lang="la">bibite, festivae fores,</quote> <trans><tr>with reference to the wine spilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palma toto anno bibere amat, i. e. aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.22" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (the <hi rend="ital">obj. acc.</hi> understood). </sense><sense id="n5275.23" n="a" level="4"> Sc. aquam: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sitis est exstincta priusquam vita bibendo (of those seized by the plague),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 569</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.24" n="b" level="4"> Of liquids in general: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam sitiens biberat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edendi mihi erit bibendique finis desideria naturae restinguere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 20:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nec bibant sine ambitione, nec edant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conducit inter cibos bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino debemus homines quod soli animalium non sitientes bibimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 23, § 42</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5275.25" n="c" level="4"> Esp. of wine: <cit><quote lang="la">es, bibe, animo obsequere mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam illud est dulce, esse et bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam diu factum postquam bibimus: nimis diu sicci sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decet luxuriosum bibendo mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jejuni biberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 28 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi> bibitur, <hi rend="ital">they drink</hi>, <hi rend="ital">he drinks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">people drink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies noctisque estur, bibitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab tertiā horā bibebatur, ludebatur, vomebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bibitur usque eo dum de solio ministretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.26" n="III" level="1"> With adverbs or adverbial phrases. </sense><sense id="n5275.27" n="a" level="4"> Of manner: <cit><quote lang="la">jucundius bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 52, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">large,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 34, 52, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fit invitatio ut Graeco more biberetur, i. e. propinando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.28" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">num. adv.</hi> denoting the number of cups: <cit><quote lang="la">jam bis bibisse oportuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic ago, semel bibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 6, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus quam deciens, Sextiliane, bibis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:26:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quare bis deciens, Sextiliane bibis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.29" n="IV" level="1"> With <case>abl.</case> or <pos>prep.</pos> and <case>abl.</case> </sense><sense id="n5275.30" n="1" level="3"> Of the liquid, river, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">de eo vino... bibito ante cenam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 114</bibl></cit>: a fonte bibatur...<pb n="236" /> <cb n="BIBU" />  an lacu, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:99:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 99, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab amne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex aquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:30:32" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 30, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex fonte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:4:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.31" n="2" level="3"> Of the vessel. </sense><sense id="n5275.32" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmā, i. e. poculo ex gemmā facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 506</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelato = e poculo caelato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:304" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fictilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:37:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:85:1" default="NO">4, 85, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossibus humanorum capitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 12</bibl></cit>.—And bibere understood: <cit><quote lang="la">poscunt majoribus poculis, i. e. bibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.33" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: ex solido auro, L. Varius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e gemmā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:3:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 3, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.34" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hac licet in gemmā bibas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:120" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 120</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Priami calathis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 453" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 453</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in argento potorio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:12:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ossibus capitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.35" n="V" level="1"> Particular phrases. </sense><sense id="n5275.36" n="1" level="3"> Bibe si bibis = bibe nunc, si omnino bibere vis, a formula urging to drink, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 51</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">age, si quid agis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 4, 35</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n5275.37" n="2" level="3"> Dare bibere, <hi rend="ital">to give to drink</hi>, a Grecism, perh. only in the foll. passages: date illi biber, Titin ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 99</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. v. 78 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">jubebat biber dari, Fann. Ann. ib: bibere da usque plenis cantharis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 40</bibl></cit> (45): <cit><quote lang="la">quod jussi ei dari bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Jovi bibere ministraret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut bibere sibi juberet dari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:47:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 47, 5</bibl></cit>: cf.: dare with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum vos date bibat tibicini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 16</bibl></cit>.—And with <hi rend="ital">rel.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimium dabat quod biberem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dat aquam quam bibant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5275.38" n="3" level="3"> Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">aut bibat aut abeat, taken from the Greek banquets, in which the chairman (arbiter bibendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>) could demand unconditional submission to the drinking laws (<foreign lang="greek">h\\ pi=qi, h)\ a)/piqi</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:41:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 41, 118</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5276" type="hapax" key="bi^bo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. bibo</etym>, <sense id="n5276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tippler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drunkard</hi>, Firm. Math. 5, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n5276.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a kind of worm bred in wine</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 8, 16</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 406 Rib.; al. bibiones).</sense></entryFree>
bibonius: <entryFree id="n5277" type="gloss" key="bi^bo_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <foreign lang="greek">polupo/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n5277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hard drinker</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tippler</hi>, Vet. Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
bibosus: <entryFree id="n5278" type="main" key="bi^bo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">given to drinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fond of drink</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 12, 4</bibl>; besides only in Nigidius, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bibracte: <entryFree id="n5279" type="main" key="Bibracte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bibracte</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> Bibracte, but -ti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 55</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*frou/rion *bi/brakta</foreign>, Strabo; <foreign lang="greek">*au)gousto/dounon</foreign>, Ptolem., <sense id="n5279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chief town of the Ædui</hi>, later <hi rend="ital">Augustodunum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Autun</hi> en Bourgogne, Dép. de Saōne et Loire, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 63</bibl>; 7, 90; 8, 1; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 43</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">DEAE BIBRACTI, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1973</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bibrax: <entryFree id="n5280" type="main" key="Bibrax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bibrax</orth>, <itype>actis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bibe</orth>, Tab. Peuting.), <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the</hi> Remi, now <hi rend="ital">Bièvre</hi>, a small place between Laon and the river Aisne, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bibrevis: <entryFree id="n5281" type="main" key="bi^bre^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbrĕvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-brevis</etym>, Latin transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di/braxus</foreign> in metre, <sense id="n5281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of two short syllables</hi>: pes, <hi rend="ital">a pyrrhic</hi>, Diom. pp. 471 and 472 P.</sense></entryFree>
bibroci: <entryFree id="n5282" type="main" key="Bibro^ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bibrŏci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a British people</hi>, acc. to Camden, in the region of the present <hi rend="ital">Bray</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bibulus: <entryFree id="n5283" type="main" key="bi^bu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. bibo</etym>. <sense id="n5283.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">drinking readily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">freely</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">bibulus Falerni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 91</bibl></cit>.—More freq., </sense><sense id="n5283.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things, <hi rend="ital">that sucks in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">absorbs moisture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <trans><tr>sand that imbibes</tr>, <tr>drinks up moisture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:376" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 376</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:901" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 901</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>a stone that absorbs moisture</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 348</bibl></cit> (qui harenarius vocatur, Serv.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:15:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 15, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16</bibl></cit> (17), 139: <cit><quote lang="la">favilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">talaria,</quote> <trans><tr>moistened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:730" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medulla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:744" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 744</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ollae bibulae aut male coctae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 45, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">papyrus,</quote> <trans><tr>growing in moist places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta,</quote> <trans><tr>blotting-paper</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">taenia papyri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 25, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:368" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 368</bibl></cit> (cf. 1. bibo, B. 1.): lanae, <hi rend="ital">absorbing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">taking color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 9</bibl> (v. poto).—</sense><sense id="n5283.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of hearing (cf. 1. bibo, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <trans><tr>ready to hear</tr>, <tr>listening</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:50" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5284" type="main" key="Bi^bu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭbŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5284.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Publicius Bibulus, <hi rend="ital">a military tribune in the time of the second Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5284.2" n="II" level="1"> M. (in Appian. Civ. 2, 8, <foreign lang="greek">*aeu/kios</foreign>) Calpurnius Bibulus, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Cœsar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consul with him</hi> A.U.C. 695, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">49</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 2</bibl>; 6, <cb n="BIDE" /> 1, 13; 6, 8, 5.—</sense><sense id="n5284.3" n="III" level="1"> C. Bibulus, <hi rend="ital">an œdile</hi> A.U.C. 775, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bicameratus: <entryFree id="n5285" type="main" key="bi^ca^me^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcămĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-camera</etym>, <sense id="n5285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a double vault</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doubly arched</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> ad Jovin. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: ecclesia, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 26.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcămĕrātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a receptacle with two compartments</hi>, Ambros. Hexaëm. 6, 9, 72.</sense></entryFree>
biceps: <entryFree id="n5286" type="main" key="bi^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭceps</orth>, <itype>cĭpĭtis</itype> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcĭpes</orth>, <itype>like ancipes for anceps</itype>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 754</bibl> P.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcepsŏs</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 50</bibl> Müll.; <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-căpĭtes</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">dike/faloi</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-caput</etym>. <sense id="n5286.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having two heads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twoheaded</hi> (rare but class.): puella nata biceps, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:53:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 53, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 21, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 65</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:4:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 4, 4, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 62, 82, § 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladius,</quote> <trans><tr>with two edges</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of mountains, <hi rend="ital">with two summits</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parnasus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 221</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:316" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 316</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 2" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5286.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">divided into two parts</hi>: bicipitem civitatem fecit, discordiarum civilium fontem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 454, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:17:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 17, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a dilemma</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 4</bibl></cit>, n. 18.</sense></entryFree>
bicessis: <entryFree id="n5287" type="main" key="bi^cessis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcessis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bis-as</etym>, <sense id="n5287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twenty</hi> asses, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=170" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 170</bibl> Müll.; cf. as, I.</sense></entryFree>
bicinium: <entryFree id="n5288" type="gloss" key="bi^ci^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bis-cano</etym>, <sense id="n5288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a duet</hi>: cum duo canunt bicinium appellatur; <cit><quote lang="la">cum multi, chorus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
biclinium: <entryFree id="n5289" type="main" key="bicli_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biclīnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vox hibrida, from bis<foreign lang="greek">kli/nh</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 68</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n5289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dining-couch for two persons</hi> (only in Plaut.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 69</bibl> (3, 84); 4, 4, 102 (3, 117).</sense></entryFree>
bicodulus: <entryFree id="n5290" type="main" key="bi^co_du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcōdŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-cauda</etym>, <sense id="n5290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two tails</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inlex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 30, p. 294, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bicolor: <entryFree id="n5291" type="main" key="bi^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcŏlor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcŏlōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 13</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-color</etym>, <sense id="n5291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of two colors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twocolored</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">baca,</quote> <trans><tr>green and black</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrtus,</quote> <trans><tr>steel-colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:234" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 234</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 52, 74, § 144</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bicomis: <entryFree id="n5292" type="main" key="bi^co^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcŏmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-coma</etym>, <sense id="n5292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with hair falling down on both sides</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a double mane</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 28, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bicorniger: <entryFree id="n5293" type="hapax" key="Bi^corni^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭcornĭger</orth>, <itype>gĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bis-corniger</etym>, <sense id="n5293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two-horned</hi>, an epithet of Bacchus (v. Bacchus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 13, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bicornis: <entryFree id="n5294" type="main" key="bi^cornis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcornis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>bis-cornu</etym>. <sense id="n5294.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">having two horns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-horned</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:304" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 304</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fauni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:268" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 268</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 99</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of a <hi rend="ital">two-pronged</hi> fork: <cit><quote lang="la">furcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:264" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 264</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 647</bibl>: ferrum, Col. Poët. 10, 148.—Of the new moon, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:35" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 35</bibl>.—Of rivers with two mouths (perh. only epith. ornans; cf. amnis <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">Rhenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Granicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:763" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 763</bibl></cit>.—Of the top of Parnassus: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:63" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 63</bibl></cit> (cf. biceps).—</sense><sense id="n5294.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcornes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">horned animals for sacrifice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">AVRATA. FRONTE. BICORNES.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2335</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bicorpor: <entryFree id="n5295" type="main" key="bi^corpor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcorpor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-corpus</etym>, <sense id="n5295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two bodies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double-bodied</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare; late prose form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcorpŏrĕ-us</orth>, Firm. Math. 2, 12): <cit><quote lang="la">bicorpores Gigantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0112,001:Bell. Pun. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Naev.</author> Bell. Pun. 2, 14</bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.): Pallas bicorpor, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 699</bibl> P.; and so besides only in Cic. in a transl. from Sophocl. Trachin.: manus, Tusc. 2, 9, 22.</sense></entryFree>
bicors: <entryFree id="n5296" type="main" key="bi^cors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcors</orth>, <itype>cordis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-cor</etym>, <sense id="n5296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with two hearts;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">dissembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> Instr. 11, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bicoxum: <entryFree id="n5297" type="gloss" key="bi^coxum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcoxum</orth> <etym>bis-coxa</etym>, <sense id="n5297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two thighs</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">di/mhron</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
bicubitalis: <entryFree id="n5298" type="main" key="bi^cu^bi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcŭbĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭcŭbĭ-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 72</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-cubitus</etym>, <sense id="n5298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of two cubits</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 94, § 253</bibl> Sillig (Jan. bipedali).</sense></entryFree>
bidens: <entryFree id="n5299" type="main" key="bi^dens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭdens</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">duidens</orth>), <itype>entis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> bidenti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 209</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 212</bibl>; Pomp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 6, 7</bibl>: <sense id="n5299.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">bidente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 159</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> bidentium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bidentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 575</bibl></cit>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-dens</etym>, <hi rend="ital">with two teeth</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n5299.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n5299.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amica, i.e. anus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 82</bibl></cit>: bos, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 206</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5299.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">with two prongs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">points</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ancora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forfex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum = forfex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cir. 212</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5299.4" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n5299.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a heavy hoe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mattock with two crooked iron teeth;</hi> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di/kella</foreign>:<cb n="BIEN" />  valido bidenti ingemere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 209</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:29" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:49" default="NO">1, 10, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:6" default="NO">2, 3, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaebam fran/gere bidentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:400" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duros jactare bidentis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 355</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durus bidens et vomer aduncus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:927" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 927</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bidentibus soli terga convertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:17:8" default="NO">4, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jul. 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 43, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:8 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 8 al.</bibl>—Hence, meton. for <hi rend="ital">agriculture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bidentis amans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:228" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5299.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">duidens</orth>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=66" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 66</bibl> Müll.; cf. the letter B), <hi rend="ital">an animal for sacrifice</hi> (swine, sheep, ox): bidentes hostiae, quae per aetatem duos dentes altiores habent, Jul. Hyg. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 6, 14</bibl>: bidentes sunt oves duos dentes longiores ceteris habentes, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=33" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 33</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 1, 9</bibl>. It is more correct to understand by bidens <hi rend="ital">an animal for sacrifice whose two rows of teeth are complete;</hi> cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 4</bibl> Müll.: ambidens sive bidens ovis appellabatur, quae superioribus et inferioribus est dentibus, and in Heb. <foreign />, the dual of <foreign />, of the two rows of teeth; v. Gesen. Heb. Lex. under <foreign />: <cit><quote lang="la">mactant lectas de more bidentīs Legiferae Cereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 57</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 93</bibl>; 12, 170; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 227</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 575</bibl>; Pompon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 206</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> from the lang. of offerings to a general use = ovis, <hi rend="ital">a sheep</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 17, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bidental: <entryFree id="n5300" type="main" key="bi^dental"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭdental</orth>, <itype>ālis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; in the lang. of religion, <sense id="n5300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place struck by lightning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consecrated by the haruspices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and enclosed;</hi> so called from the offering, bidens, with which the lightning was propitiated (v. also puteal), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=27" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 53, 26</bibl>; cf. O. Müll. Etrusk. 2, p. 171; v. Dict. of Antiq. (perh. it is better to explain bidens here as = fulmen, from its forked form; thus Bidental = Fulminar, <hi rend="ital">the temple</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the consecrated place of lightning</hi>): triste bidental Moverit incestus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 471</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:27" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 46, 41</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2483</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:606" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 606</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:864" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 864</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">The priest of a</hi> bidental: <cit><quote lang="la">BIDENTALIS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 96, 5</bibl></cit> and 6.</sense></entryFree>
bidentatio: <entryFree id="n5301" type="gloss" key="bi^denta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭdentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bidens, II. A.</etym>, <sense id="n5301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a harrowing</hi>: occatio, <foreign lang="greek">skafeto/s</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
bidis: <entryFree id="n5302" type="main" key="Bidis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bidis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">north-west of Syracuse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 53</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5302.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5302.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bidinus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Bidis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">palaestritae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 54</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5302.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bi-dini</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Bidis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biduus: <entryFree id="n5303" type="main" key="bidu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bidŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-dies</etym>, <sense id="n5303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">continuing two days</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of two days;</hi> as <pos>adj.</pos> only once, with tempus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 24, 3</bibl>, where tempus is prob. to be omitted; v. Weissenb. ad loc. But very freq. and class. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bīdŭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. tempus), <hi rend="ital">a period</hi> or <hi rend="ital">space of two days</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two days</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinito biduom aut triduom consudent (oves),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 96, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduum supererat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 6, 9</bibl>; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra quae aberant bidui (sc. spatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eximant unum aliquem diem aut summum biduum ex mense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rus ibo: ibi hoc me macerabo biduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:101 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 101 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicationes in biduum decretae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per biduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:38:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 38, 96</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Quint. prooem. 7: per insequens biduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno die longior mensis aut biduo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduo et duabus noctibus Adrumetum pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduo post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 47 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post biduum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduo continenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biennalis: <entryFree id="n5304" type="main" key="bi^enna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭennālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>biennium</etym>, <sense id="n5304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">continuing two years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of two years</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 37, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensio, Cod. Th. 11, 20, 4, § 1: culpa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12, 40, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
biennis: <entryFree id="n5305" type="main" key="bi^ennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of two years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lasting two years</hi> (very rare): biennis quasi duorum annorum, Beda, p. 2331 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 57</bibl>; Nigid. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:6:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 6, 13</bibl> (but in the phrase bienni spatio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:82:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 82, 84</bibl>. § 198 Jan., bienni is the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> of biennium).</sense></entryFree>
biennium: <entryFree id="n5306" type="main" key="bi^enni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭennĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bis-annus</etym>, <sense id="n5306.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period</hi> or <hi rend="ital">space of two years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two years</hi>: jam biennium<pb n="237" /> <cb n="BIFO" />  est, cum, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra tempus biennii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc factum est ferme abhinc biennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit> (imitated by Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. prol. 12</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">biennium ibi perpetuum misera illum tuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">biennium provinciam obtinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:93:section=216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 93, § 216</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 30, § 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex usum et auctoritatem fundi jubet esse biennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:19:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 19, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Ep. ad Tryph. 1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Ep. ad Tryph. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Inst. 1:12:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inst. 1, 12, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">biennio postquam abii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia biennio habita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matres, quae biennio durant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 21, 24, § 73</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum biennio post ultro petiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra tempus bienni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:R. R. 3:9:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra biennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultra biennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bifariam: <entryFree id="n5307" type="main" key="bi^fa_ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfārĭam</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. bifarius, A.</entryFree>
bifarius: <entryFree id="n5308" type="main" key="bi^fa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis, after the analogy of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">difa/sios</foreign>; cf.: ambifarius, trifarius, multifarius, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n5308.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twofold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double</hi> (as <pos>adj.</pos> only post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 39, 16</bibl></cit> dub. (al. bifariam).—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos> in two forms. </sense><sense id="n5308.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfārĭam</orth> (<hi rend="ital">acc. fem.</hi> sc. partem), <hi rend="ital">on two sides</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">twofold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in two ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in two parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in two places</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twice</hi>, etc. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut dispertirem obsonium hic bifariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus bifariam divisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 32, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 19, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bifariam quattuor perturbationes aequaliter distributae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 11, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (inflexionem) bifariam contrarie simul procedentia efficiebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita bifariam consules ingressi hostium fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemina victoria duobus bifariam proeliis parta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 63, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra bifariam facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 21, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bifariam laudatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:100" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 100</bibl></cit>: bifariam cum populo agi non potest, Messala ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:15:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 15, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5308.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare): bifariam intellegere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">in both ways</hi> or <hi rend="ital">senses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:10:4:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 10, 4, § 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 39, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5308.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfārĭes</orth>, <hi rend="ital">doubly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> de Or. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> p. 601 Garet.</sense></entryFree>
bifax: <entryFree id="n5309" type="gloss" key="bi^fax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfax</orth>, <itype>dīfax</itype>, <sense id="n5309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two-faced</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">dipro/swpos</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr. [bis-facies].</sense></entryFree>
bifer: <entryFree id="n5310" type="main" key="bi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfer</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-fero</etym>. <sense id="n5310.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bearing fruit twice a year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbor, malus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:7:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:403" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 403</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:11" default="NO">5, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 22, 41, § 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:114" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 27, 50, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 76</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">biferique rosaria Paesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 119</bibl></cit> (acc. to Serv. the rose blossomed twice in a year at Paestum).— * </sense><sense id="n5310.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">of twofold form</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">biferum Centauri corpus,</quote> <trans><tr>a horse and man</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 230</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bifestus: <entryFree id="n5311" type="hapax" key="bi^festus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-festus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis</etym>, <sense id="n5311.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubly festive</hi>: dies, <hi rend="ital">a twofold festival</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 12, 66.</sense></entryFree>
bifidatus: <entryFree id="n5312" type="hapax" key="bi^fi^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfĭdātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bifidus</etym>, <sense id="n5312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divided into two parts</hi> (v. bifidus): <cit><quote lang="la">lateribus in sese bifidatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 7, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bifidus: <entryFree id="n5313" type="main" key="bi^fi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-findo</etym>, <sense id="n5313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divided into two parts</hi> (the usual form; <cit><quote lang="la">rarer bifidatus and bifissus): bifidos relinquit Rima pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stirps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 20, 34, § 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus venarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 39, 76, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:570" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 570</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bifilum: <entryFree id="n5314" type="gloss" key="bi^fi_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfīlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bis-filum</etym>, <sense id="n5314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double thread</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 12, 375</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bifissus: <entryFree id="n5315" type="hapax" key="bi^fissus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-findo</etym>, <sense id="n5315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cleft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divided into two parts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> (v. bifidus).</sense></entryFree>
biforis: <entryFree id="n5316" type="main" key="bi^fo^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfŏris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfŏrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-foris</etym>. <sense id="n5316.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having two doors</hi> or <hi rend="ital">folding-doors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5316.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Having two openings</hi> or <hi rend="ital">holes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via (narium),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 1</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi assuetis biforem dat tibia cantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:618" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 618</bibl></cit> (bisonum, imparem, Serv.); <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Cent. Nupt. 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">biforis tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:668" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 668</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
biformatus: <entryFree id="n5317" type="hapax" key="bi^forma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-formātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis</etym>, <sense id="n5317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubleformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-shaped</hi>: non biformato impetu Centaurus (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> for biformatus Centaurus impetu), Cic. poët. Tusc. 2, 8, 20 Kühner; v. biformis.</sense></entryFree>
biformis: <entryFree id="n5318" type="main" key="bi^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭformis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-forma</etym>, <sense id="n5318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">double</hi> or <hi rend="ital">two-formed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-shaped</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">proles biformis Minotaurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scyllae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 286</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 156</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Janus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 424</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hermaphroditus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:387" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 387</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pater, i. e. Chiron,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:664" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 664</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hodites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:456" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:156" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 156</bibl></cit>: a <cb n="BIGR" /> Centaur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 12, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 329</bibl> (cf. biformatus): <cit><quote lang="la">Pan,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:427" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Glaucus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cecrops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 7</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a poet (as man and swan): vates, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">biformes hominum partus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
biforus: <entryFree id="n5319" type="main" key="bi^fo^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfŏrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. biforis.</entryFree>
bifrons: <entryFree id="n5320" type="main" key="bi^frons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-frons</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis</etym>, <sense id="n5320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with two foreheads</hi>, or, in a more extended sense, <hi rend="ital">with two faces</hi>, an epithet of Janus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 180</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 198</bibl>; Gav. Bass. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bifurcus: <entryFree id="n5321" type="main" key="bi^furcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfurcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-furca</etym>, <sense id="n5321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two prongs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">points</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-pronged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <trans><tr>two-forked</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 442</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 18, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 30, 53, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.— Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭfurcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 6</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of the place where two branches start, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 10</bibl>.—Of the connection of two veins upon the head of draught-cattle, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 40, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, sudor mihi per bifurcum volabat,</quote> <trans><tr>over the cheeks down to the neck</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bigae: <entryFree id="n5322" type="main" key="bi_gae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīgae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (in <number>plur.</number> through the whole ante-Aug. per.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:39:142" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 39, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:10:2:165" default="NO">10, 2, 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:10:3:177" default="NO">10, 3, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 2, 272</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 20</bibl> P.; post-Aug. also in <number>sing.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bīga</orth>, ae; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:45" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:338" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 338</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1520" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1520</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:141" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 40, § 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2545</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 21, 9</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, 462; v. also trigae and quadrigae), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for bijugae from bis-jugum</etym>, <sense id="n5322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pair of horses</hi> or (rarely) <hi rend="ital">of other animals;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a two-horsed car</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chariot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bigas primas junxit Phrygum natio: quadrigas Erichthonius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhesi niveae citaeque bigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hector raptatus bigis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nox atra polum bigis subvecta tenebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 721</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:211" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 211</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">roseae Aurorae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:26 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 26 al.</bibl></cit>: cornutae, <hi rend="ital">a team for ploughing</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 164, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 36, 1</bibl> and 2.—Stamped on a coin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 46</bibl>; v. bigatus.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equis bigis meare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
