bigamus: <entryFree id="n5323" type="gloss" key="bi^ga^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭgămus</orth>, <sense id="n5323.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twice married</hi> [vox hibrida, bis-<foreign lang="greek">game/w</foreign>]: <cit><quote lang="la">a numero uxorum vocatus, quasi duabus maritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 9, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Dignit. Sac. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bigarius: <entryFree id="n5324" type="gloss" key="bi_ga_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīgārius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bigae</etym>, <sense id="n5324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a driver of a pair of horses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 621, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bigatus: <entryFree id="n5325" type="main" key="bi_ga_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīgātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the figure of a</hi> bigae (exclusively of coin); <hi rend="ital">with the figure of a</hi> bigae <hi rend="ital">stamped upon it</hi> (cf. Dict. of Antiq.): <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 23, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 37, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21:11" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 21, 11</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bīgā-tus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. nummus), <hi rend="ital">a silver coin with the stamp of the</hi> bigae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 46</bibl>: nummi quadrigati et bigati a figurā caelaturae dicti, Paul. ex Fest. s. v. grave aes, p. 98 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 15, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bigeminus: <entryFree id="n5326" type="main" key="bi^ge^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭgĕmĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-geminus</etym>, <sense id="n5326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubled</hi>, Poët. ap. Mar. Vict. 2572 P</sense></entryFree>
bigemmis: <entryFree id="n5327" type="main" key="bi^gemmis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭgemmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-gemma</etym>. * <sense id="n5327.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Set with two precious stones</hi>: anulus, Val. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5327.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of plants, <hi rend="ital">having two buds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bigener: <entryFree id="n5328" type="main" key="bi^ge^ner"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭgĕner</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-genus, like degener from de-genus, and bicorpor from bis-corpus</etym>, <sense id="n5328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">descended from two different races</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hybrid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mongrel</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=33:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 33, 14</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">muli et hinni bigeneri atque insiticii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bigerra: <entryFree id="n5329" type="main" key="Bigerra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bigerra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">in the province of the</hi> Bastitani, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:41:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 41, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bigerriones: <entryFree id="n5330" type="main" key="Bi^gerri^o_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭgerrĭōnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭgerri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. ad Aus. 10, 246</bibl>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĕgerri</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5330.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic people in Aquitania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Bigorre</hi>, De/part. des hautes Pyre/ne/es, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 27</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5330.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5330.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭgerrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Bigerriones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo,</quote> <trans><tr>blowing from thence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 12</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">fem. absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭgerrĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. vestis), <hi rend="ital">a warm shaggy garment</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 2, 1</bibl>; Ven. de Vita S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:49" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5330.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭgerrĭtā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Bigerriones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
bignae: <entryFree id="n5331" type="gloss" key="bignae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bignae</orth>, <sense id="n5331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">female twins</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=33:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 33, 3</bibl> Müll. [contr. from bigenae, from bisgigno].</sense></entryFree>
bigradum: <entryFree id="n5332" type="gloss" key="bigra^dum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bigrădum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">di/baqmon</foreign>: duos habens gradus, Gloss. Gr. Lat. <cb n="BILI" /></entryFree>
bigus: <entryFree id="n5333" type="main" key="bi_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīgus</orth>, v. bijugus <sense id="n5333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
bijugis: <entryFree id="n5334" type="main" key="bi^ju^gi^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭjŭgĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-jugum</etym> (a rare form for bijugus). <sense id="n5334.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">yoked two together</hi>: equi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 91</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bijugum Colla lyncum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curriculum,</quote> <trans><tr>drawn by a pair of horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5334.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">double</hi>: uno bijuges tolli de limine fasces, i. e. <hi rend="ital">two brothers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consuls from one family</hi>, Claud. Prob. et Olyb. 233.</sense></entryFree>
bijugus: <entryFree id="n5335" type="main" key="bi^ju^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭjŭgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (contr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bīgus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 3</bibl>; cf. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭjŭgis</orth>, e), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">yoked two together</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">leones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 602</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:253" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 253</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:13:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:218" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 218</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <trans><tr>drawn by two horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:723" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 723</bibl></cit>: certamen = bigarum, <hi rend="ital">the contest with the</hi> bigae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 144</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5335.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-jŭgi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. equi), <hi rend="ital">two horses yoked abreast</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">telo Admonuit bijugos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 587</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 399</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desiluit Turnus bijugis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from his chariot drawn by two horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 453</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bilanx: <entryFree id="n5336" type="hapax" key="bi^lanx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-lanx</orth>, <itype>lancis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-lanx</etym>, <sense id="n5336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two scales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 180</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bilbilis: <entryFree id="n5337" type="main" key="Bilbi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bilbĭlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n5337.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in an elevated position in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">on the river Salo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the poet Martial</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Calatayud Vieja</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bilbilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:103:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 103, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bilbilim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:50:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 50, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 144</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bilbilin,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:55:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 55, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:104:6" default="NO">10, 104, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:18:9" default="NO">12, 18, 9</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5337.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bilbĭlĭ-tānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Bilbilis</hi>: aquae, <hi rend="ital">a medicinal spring in the vicinity of Bilbilis</hi>, Itin. Anton.—</sense><sense id="n5337.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The river Salo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Bilbilis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Xalon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bilbo: <entryFree id="n5338" type="hapax" key="bilbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bilbo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>onomatop.</etym>, <sense id="n5338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make a noise like that of a liquid agitated in a vessel</hi>: bilbit factum est a similitudine sonitus, qui fit in vase. Naevius Bilbit amphora inquit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=34" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 34</bibl> Müll. (Com. Trag. v. 124 Rib.): bilbit <foreign lang="greek">bombu/zei</foreign>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
bilibra: <entryFree id="n5339" type="hapax" key="bi^li_bra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭlībra</orth>. <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bis-libra</etym>, <sense id="n5339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two pounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilibrae farris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 15, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bilibralis: <entryFree id="n5340" type="gloss" key="bi^li_bra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭlībrālis</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">dilitriai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n5340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weighing two pounds</hi>, Gloss. Cyril.</sense></entryFree>
bilibris: <entryFree id="n5341" type="main" key="bi^li_bris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭlībris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> <etym>bilibra</etym>, <sense id="n5341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of two pounds.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5341.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n5341.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Weighing two pounds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">offae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 26, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:45:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 45, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5341.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Containing two pounds</hi>: aqualis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5341.4" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a quantity of two pounds</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 6, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bilinguis: <entryFree id="n5342" type="main" key="bi^linguis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭlinguis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis - lingua</etym>, <sense id="n5342.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twotongued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double-tongued.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5342.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">having two tongues;</hi> humorously, of voluptuous persons kissing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 65</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5342.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5342.3" n="1" level="3"> Tibiae, <hi rend="ital">with two keys</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 229, 24</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5342.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Speaking two languages</hi>: bilinguis <foreign lang="greek">di/glwssos</foreign>, Gloss.: bilingues Bruttates Ennius dixit, quod Bruttii et Osce et Graece loqui soliti sint, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Commod.</author> p. 350</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvinus, Canusini more bilinguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed jam bilingues erant, paulatim a domestico externo sermone degeneres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 29</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5342.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5342.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Double-tongued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hypocritical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">false</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treacherous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam proserpens bestia, est bilinguis et scelestus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">edico prius, Ne duplicis habeatis linguas, ne ego bilinguis vos necem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 7</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bisulcilingua quasi proserpens bestia): quippe domum timet ambiguam Tyriosque bilinguis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 661</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:56" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:157" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 284</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5342.7" n="B" level="2"> Fabulae, <hi rend="ital">having a double meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allegorical</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, p. 228</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biliosus: <entryFree id="n5343" type="main" key="bi_li^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīlĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bilis</etym>. <sense id="n5343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of bile</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bilious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sputum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>' biliosa reicere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:168" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 168</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bīlĭō-sus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bilious person</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">hypochondriac</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">biliosus, quod sit semper tristis, ab umore nigro, qui bilis vocatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 10, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bilis: <entryFree id="n5344" type="main" key="bi_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīlis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>abl.</case> bili, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 664</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl>; <sense id="n5344.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">bile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 124, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 20, 23, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:2:14" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1040, 3</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with galbus, gilbus; Germ. gelb</etym>. </sense><sense id="n5344.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">bile</hi> (the bilious fluid secreted by the liver, jecur, while fel is the vessel in which the fluid is contained): rufa, viridis, nigra, Ceis. 7, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:664" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 664</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156, 4</bibl>; Cic. <pb n="238" /> <cb n="BIME" /> N. D. 2, 55, 137; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 10, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem pellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 8, 74, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 4, 10, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 12, 93, § 119</bibl></cit>.— In <number>plur.</number> biles, <hi rend="ital">the yellow and black bile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 34, § 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 136" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 136</bibl></cit> (cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">purgor bilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 302</bibl></cit>). —</sense><sense id="n5344.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp.: bilis suffusa, <hi rend="ital">the overflowing of bile</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the jaundice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 54</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 16</bibl>, called subfusio luridae bilis).—And so, bile suffusus, <hi rend="ital">having the jaundice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jaundiced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 20, 23, § 49</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5344.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5344.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Anger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wrath</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">displeasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indignation</hi> (v. jecur): <cit><quote lang="la">non placet mihi cena, quae bilem movet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem alicui commovere,</quote> <trans><tr>to stir up</tr>, <tr>excite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bile tumet jecur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meum jecur urere bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilis inaestuat praecordiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jussit quod splendida bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expulit bilem meraco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilem effundere,</quote> <trans><tr>to vent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:159" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turgescit vitrea bilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui sententiae tantum bilis, tantum amaritudinis inest, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: videte metuendam inimici et hostis bilem et licentiam, Cic. Fragm. Clod. et Cur. 4, 4 B. and K.—</sense><sense id="n5344.5" n="B" level="2"> Atra (or nigra) bilis, <hi rend="ital">black bile</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">melancholy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sadness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dejection</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">melagxoli/a</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 11</bibl>: bilem atram generantes, quos <foreign lang="greek">melagxolikou\s</foreign> vocant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 104" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 104</bibl>.—Also as in Gr., = furor, <hi rend="ital">rage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">madness: Am.</hi> Delirat uxor. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Atra bili percita est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bilis nigra curanda est, et ipsa furoris causa removenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bilix:
<entryFree id="n5345" type="hapax" key="bi^lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭlix</orth>, <itype>līcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis - licium</etym>, <sense id="n5345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a double thread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-threaded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lorica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:375" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 375</bibl></cit> Heyn.; cf. trilix.
‡†† <orth extent="full" lang="la">billis</orth> <itype>apud Afros appellatur semen humanum humi profusum</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=34" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 34</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
bilongus: <entryFree id="n5346" type="gloss" key="bi^longus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-longus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis</etym>, <sense id="n5346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">doubly long</hi>: pes, <hi rend="ital">consisting of two long syllables</hi>, Mar. Vict. p. 2486 P.</sense></entryFree>
bilustris: <entryFree id="n5347" type="main" key="bi^lustris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭlustris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis - lustrum</etym>, <sense id="n5347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that lasts two</hi> lustra, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ten years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of ten years</hi>' <hi rend="ital">duration</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 12, 9</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 299</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bilychnis: <entryFree id="n5348" type="main" key="bi^lychnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭlychnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-lychnus</etym>, <sense id="n5348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two lights</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 30, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 36, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bimammius: <entryFree id="n5349" type="hapax" key="bi^mammi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭmammĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-mamma</etym>, <sense id="n5349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two breasts;</hi> and trop., of the vine, <hi rend="ital">having double clusters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bimaris: <entryFree id="n5350" type="main" key="bi^ma^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭmăris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis - mare</etym>, <sense id="n5350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying between two seas.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5350.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, an epithet of Corinth (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; a favorite word of Ovid): bimarisve Corinthi Moenia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 407</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ephyre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isthmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 405</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 419</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n5350.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <trans><tr>of one who practises unnatural unchastity</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 131</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bimaritus: <entryFree id="n5351" type="main" key="bi^ma^ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-mărītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bis</etym>, <sense id="n5351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the husband of two wives</hi> (a word coined by Laterensis, the accuser of Plancius): <cit><quote lang="la">bimaritum appellas, ut verba etiam fingas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 12, 30</bibl></cit>; and besides only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1</bibl>, n. 49.</sense></entryFree>
bimatris: <entryFree id="n5352" type="main" key="bi^ma_tris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭmātris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis - mater</etym>, <sense id="n5352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two mothers</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of Bacchus (v. Bacchus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">satumque iterum solumque bimatrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 167" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 167</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, 19, 2</bibl> (where it is scanned bīmăter).</sense></entryFree>
bimatus: <entryFree id="n5353" type="main" key="bi_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīmātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bimus</etym>, <sense id="n5353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the age of two years</hi> (of animals and plants): <cit><quote lang="la">ante bimatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:4" default="NO">7, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(polypi) ultra bimatum non vivunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:73" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 21, 24, § 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque his bimatu longior vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 93</bibl></cit>.—Of children, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bimembris: <entryFree id="n5354" type="main" key="bi^membris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭmembris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis - membrum</etym>, <sense id="n5354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having double members</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer,</quote> <trans><tr>half man</tr>, <tr>half beast</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 64</bibl></cit>; most freq. a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the Centaurs (<hi rend="ital">half man</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half horse;</hi> cf. bicorpor and biformis): <cit><quote lang="la">Centauri bimembres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:41" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma bimembris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5354.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭmembres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, = Centauri, <hi rend="ital">the Centaurs</hi>: nubigenae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 293</bibl> Heyn. and Jahn; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 240</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 494</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 283</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:554" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 554</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bimenstruus: <entryFree id="n5355" type="gloss" key="bi^menstruus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭmenstruus</orth> <etym>bis-mensis</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">dimhniai=os</foreign>, <sense id="n5355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of two months</hi>, Gloss. Cyril.</sense></entryFree>
bimestris: <entryFree id="n5356" type="main" key="bi^mestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭmestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<case>abl.</case> regularly bimestri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 15</bibl>; by <usg type="style">poet.</usg> license, bimestre, <cb n="BINI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:158" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 158</bibl>; cf. caelestis, perennis, etc.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-mensis</etym>, <sense id="n5356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of two months</hi>' <hi rend="ital">duration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of two months</hi> (rare): consulatus, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 43, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triticum,</quote> <trans><tr>which may be reaped two months after sowing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 12, § 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcus,</quote> <trans><tr>two months old</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:158" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 158</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bimeter: <entryFree id="n5357" type="main" key="bi^me^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭmĕter</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-metrum</etym>, = dimeter, <sense id="n5357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of two metres</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bimulus: <entryFree id="n5358" type="main" key="bi_mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīmŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n5358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [bimus], <hi rend="ital">only two years old</hi> (very rare, and only of man), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
bimus: <entryFree id="n5359" type="main" key="bi_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>prob. contracted from bis-hiems, of two winters; cf. Eutych. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> p. 2311</bibl> P., and Aufrecht, Zeitschrift für vergl. Sprachf. 4, p. 415</etym>, <sense id="n5359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two years old</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of two years</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continuing two years</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 17, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 13</bibl>: una veterana legio, altera bima, octo tironum, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 3</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">semen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 24, 54, § 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">surculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 14, 24, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae,</quote> <trans><tr>biennial</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 2</bibl></cit>: merum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 19, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:16" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:9:64" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 9, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestimatio ususfructus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:2:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si legatum sit relictum annua, bima, trima die, etc., i. e. solvendum intra annum, biennium, triennium, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:1:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. dies.—* </sense><sense id="n5359.1" n="II" level="1"> In epist. style, as an abbreviated expression: <cit><quote lang="la">bima sententia,</quote> <trans><tr>the vote concerning the continuance of a provincial government for two years</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
binarius: <entryFree id="n5360" type="main" key="bi_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bini</etym>, <sense id="n5360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that contains</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consists of two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">formae,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>coins of the value of two gold pieces</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bingium: <entryFree id="n5361" type="main" key="Bingi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bingĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n5361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying on the Rhine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite the modern Bingen</hi>, on the west bank of the Nahe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bini: <entryFree id="n5362" type="main" key="bi_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīni</orth>, <itype>ae, a</itype> (in <number>sing.</number> only twice, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 452</bibl>, and 5, 877; <sense id="n5362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> always binūm, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 80, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 22</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 31, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 8" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 8</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">num. distr.</hi> [bis]. </sense><sense id="n5362.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Two by two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two to each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two each</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two at a time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam ex his praediis talenta argenti bina Statim capiebat,</quote> <trans><tr>every year two talents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">describebat censores binos in singulas civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:53:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 53, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si unicuique bini pedes (campi) assignentur,</quote> <trans><tr>two to each</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distribuit binos (gladiatores) singulis patribus familiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annua imperia binosque imperatores sibi fecere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carthagine quotannis annui bini reges creabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illos binas aut amplius domos continuare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inermes cum binis vestimentis velitis ab Sagunto exire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bini senatores singulis cohortibus propositi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 69, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:30:10" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 30, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentes triceni bini viris attribuuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:69" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 9, 14, § 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5362.2" n="B" level="2"> Taking the place of the cardinal number duo, with <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> which are <number>plur.</number> only, or with those which have a diff. signif. in the <number>plur.</number> from the <number>sing.</number> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 8, 168</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">binae (litterae),</quote> <trans><tr>two</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bina castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">binae hostium copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter binos ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:52:section=130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 52, § 130</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">binis centesimis faeneratus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 70</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">165: bini codicilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: bina milia, <hi rend="ital">two thousand</hi>, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 80, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bina milia passuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:77" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 77</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n5362.3" n="II" level="1"> Of things that are in pairs or double, <hi rend="ital">a pair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">double</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boves bini,</quote> <trans><tr>a yoke of oxen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1299</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si forte oculo manus uni subdita supter Pressit eum... Omnia quae tuimur fieri tum bina tuendo, bina lumina, Binaque supellex, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 449</bibl></cit> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:879" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 879</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">binos (scyphos) habebam,</quote> <trans><tr>a pair</tr>, <tr>two of like form</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per binos tabellarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 33, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeribus binis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:292" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 292</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bina hastilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 3, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5362.4" n="B" level="2"> Without <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec findi in bina secando,</quote> <trans><tr>into two parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:534" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 534</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si bis bina quot essent didicisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5362.5" n="III" level="1"> Bini, in mal. part. (cf. <foreign lang="greek">binei=</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
binio: <entryFree id="n5363" type="gloss" key="bi_nio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīnio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bini</etym>, <sense id="n5363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number two</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a deuce</hi>: jactus quisque apud lusores veteres<cb n="BIPA" />  a numero vocabatur, ut unio, binio, tri nio, quaternio, quinio, senio, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 65</bibl>: biniones <foreign lang="greek">dhna/ria</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
binoctium: <entryFree id="n5364" type="main" key="bi^nocti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭnoctĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bis-nox</etym>, <sense id="n5364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a period</hi> or <hi rend="ital">space of two nights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two nights</hi> (post-Aug and rare; perh. only in the two foll. exs.), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduum et binoctium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
binominis: <entryFree id="n5365" type="main" key="bi^no_mi^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭnōmĭnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-nomen, analog. to cognominis, from con-nomen</etym>, <sense id="n5365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two names</hi> (only in Ov. and in <hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi>): binominis, cui geminum est nomen, ut Numa Pompilius, Tullus Hostilius, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=36" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 36</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ascanius (also called Iulus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 609</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ister (also called Danubius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:8:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:415" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 415</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
binubus: <entryFree id="n5366" type="main" key="bi^nu_bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭnūbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bis-nubo</etym>, <sense id="n5366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doublymarried man</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Sacr. 9, 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
binus: <entryFree id="n5367" type="main" key="bi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. bini.</entryFree>
biocolyta: <entryFree id="n5368" type="greek" key="bi^o^co_ly_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭŏcōlȳta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">biokwluth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who protects against violence</hi>, Jul. Epit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:15:60" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> 15, 60</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bion: <entryFree id="n5369" type="main" key="Bi^o_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭōn</orth> (in the class. per. perh. more correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bio</orth>, analog. to Plato, Meno, Dio, etc.), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bi/wn (o( *borusqeni/ths</foreign>, Strab.), <sense id="n5369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very witty philosopher of the Cyrenaic school</hi>, <hi rend="ital">born at Borysthenes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">facetum illud Bionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 62</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Bionian</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">witty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">satirical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">biting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic delectatur iambis, Ille Bioneis sermonibus et sale nigro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit> Orell. ad loc. (Bioneis sermonibus, lividis jocis, id est, satira, Acro).—</sense><sense id="n5369.1" n="II" level="1"> Bion Soleus or Soleusis, <hi rend="ital">a writer on agriculture</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 35, § 178</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biopator: <entryFree id="n5370" type="main" key="Bi^o^pa^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭŏpător</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a town founded by the Trojans in Epirus</hi>, otherwise unknown, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 349</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bios: <entryFree id="n5371" type="greek" key="bi^o^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bi/os</foreign> (life), <sense id="n5371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very celebrated and wholesome Greek wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 8, 10, § 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:53" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 26, § 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biothanatus: <entryFree id="n5372" type="greek" key="bi^o^tha^na^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭŏthănătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">bioqa/natos [bi/a - qa/natos</foreign>], <sense id="n5372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that dies a violent death</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 33</bibl>; Firm. Math. 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 4, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg A. 4, 386</bibl>.—Collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭaeŏthănătus</orth>, from <foreign lang="greek">bi/aios-qa/natos</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bioticus: <entryFree id="n5373" type="greek" key="bi^o_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭōtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">biwtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to common life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used in common life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">practical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">epilogi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg A. 3, 718</bibl></cit>: metrum, Mar. Vict. p. 2494 P. (in <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 470</bibl> ib. written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
bipalium: <entryFree id="n5374" type="main" key="bi^pa_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpālĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bis-pala</etym>, <sense id="n5374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double mattock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum ad bipalium defodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 17</bibl></cit> Schneid. ad loc. (MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpĕdā-lĭum</orth>; elsewhere only in <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">bipalio vertere terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipalio agrum subigere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37:5" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:11" default="NO">11, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:230" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 26, 62, § 230</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bipalmis: <entryFree id="n5375" type="main" key="bi^palmis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpalmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpalmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 7</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-palmus</etym>, <sense id="n5375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two spans long</hi> or <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of two spans</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tabulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:7:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spiculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 65, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bipartio: <entryFree id="n5376" type="main" key="bi^parti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-partĭo</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-pertĭo</orth>), no <sense id="n5376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ītum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>bis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to divide into two parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to bisect</hi> (as <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> very rare; more freq. in <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos>): ver bipartitur, <hi rend="ital">is divided</hi> (in respect to weather), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:36" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 36</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hiems bipertitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—Mostly <hi rend="ital">part. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipartita divisio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 17</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus bipartitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:22:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 22, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipertiti Aethiopes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 8, 8, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut faceres imperium bipartitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 47, 23</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpartītō</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">bĭpert-</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">in two parts</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in two ways</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipartito classem distribuere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 14, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 6, 13</bibl>: signa inferre, <hi rend="ital">to attack in two parties</hi> or <hi rend="ital">divisions</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collocare insidias in silvis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites bipertito in eos emissi magnam caedem edidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 32, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secta bipartito cum mens discurrit utroque,</quote> <trans><tr>in two different directions</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 443</bibl></cit>.—With esse or fieri (cf. in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di/xa ei)=nai, gi/gnesqai</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ibi in proximis villis ita bipartito fuerunt ut Tiberis inter eos et pons interesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit> B. and K.: <cit><quote lang="la">id fit bipartito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:29:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 29, 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bipatens: <entryFree id="n5377" type="main" key="bi^pa^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpătens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-pateo</etym>, <sense id="n5377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">opening in two ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">open in two directions</hi> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 5</bibl>, used by Enn.; cf. Ann. v. 62 Vahl.; but only two exs. in Verg. <pb n="239" /> <cb n="BIPE" /> are preserved): <cit><quote lang="la">portis alii bipatentibus assunt, i.e. portis duarum valvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 330</bibl></cit> Wagn.—Of the doors of the dwellings of the gods: <cit><quote lang="la">considunt tectis bipatentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 5</bibl></cit> (est autem sermo Ennianus tractus ab ostiis, quae ex utrāque parte aperiuntur, Serv.).</sense></entryFree>
bipeda: <entryFree id="n5378" type="main" key="bi^pe^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpĕda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bis-pes</etym>, <sense id="n5378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flagstone two feet long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for pavements</hi> (several times in Pall., elsewh. very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40, 2</bibl> and 5; id. Mai, 11, 2 (twice); <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 511, 159</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: tegulae bipedales).</sense></entryFree>
bipedalis: <entryFree id="n5379" type="main" key="bi^pe^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpĕdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two feet long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thick</hi> (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">fenestrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes,</quote> <trans><tr>two feet thick</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: sol huic (Epicuro) bipedalis fortasse videtur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 6, 20</bibl>: adulescentulus bipedali minor, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 309</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5379.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpĕdāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a tile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flag-stone two feet long</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 500, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bepedalium: <entryFree id="n5380" type="main" key="be^pe^da_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĕpĕdālĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bipedalis</etym>, a doubtful reading for bipalium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 17</bibl> Schneid. ad loc.; v. bipalium.</entryFree>
bipedaneus: <entryFree id="n5381" type="main" key="bi^pe^da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpĕdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-pes</etym>, <sense id="n5381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">two feet long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wide</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">thick</hi> (a rare access. form of bipedalis; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Col.): scrobs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:30:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, 21</bibl></cit> Gesn. and Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">latitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:28" default="NO">11, 2, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastinatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 20, 32, § 143</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bipennifer: <entryFree id="n5382" type="main" key="bi^penni^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpennĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. bipennis-fero</etym>, <sense id="n5382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bearing a two-edged axe</hi> (only in Ov.): <cit><quote lang="la">Lycurgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arcas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 391</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bipennis: <entryFree id="n5383" type="main" key="bi^pennis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpennis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-pinnis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bispenna</etym>, <sense id="n5383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two wings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-winged</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">insectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 28, 33, § 96</bibl></cit> (cf. just before, binis advolat pinnis): plumae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5384" type="main" key="bi^pennis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpennis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n5384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing.</hi> reg. bipennem, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 307</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 651</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:657" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 657</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 333</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:64" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 64</bibl>: bipennim, only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 766</bibl>, with the var. lect. bipennem.—<hi rend="ital">Abl. sing.</hi> reg. bipenni, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 479</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:611" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 611</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 800" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 800</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 345</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 377</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:264" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 264</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in prose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bipenne, only once,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:47" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 47</bibl></cit>) [bis-pinna]. </sense><sense id="n5384.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">having two edges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-edged</hi>: securis, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 135</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n5384.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpen-nis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. securis; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 652</bibl> P.), <hi rend="ital">an axe with two edges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a battle-axe</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; only found in the <case>nom.</case>, <case>dat.</case>, <case>acc.</case>, and <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>, and in <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">bipennis dicitur, quod ex utrāque parte habeat acutam aciem, quasi duas pennas. Pennum autem antiqui acutum dicebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 19, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 1, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a pinnā (quod est acutum) securis utrinque habens aciem bipennis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">correptā dura bipenni Limina perrumpit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 479</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 627</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 331</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 611</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duris ut ilex tonsa bipennibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 57</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 414</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 8, 8, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:264" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 264</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bipensilis: <entryFree id="n5385" type="hapax" key="bi^pensi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-pensĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis</etym>, <sense id="n5385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be suspended on two sides</hi>: forcipes, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 99, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bipertio: <entryFree id="n5386" type="main" key="bi^pertio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpertio</orth>, etc., v. bipartio, etc.</entryFree>
bipes: <entryFree id="n5387" type="main" key="bi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpēs</orth> (˘˘, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 39</bibl>; <sense id="n5387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> bipedia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mor. Manich. 9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mor. Manich. 9</bibl>), <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-pes</etym>, <hi rend="ital">two-footed</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 389</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:32:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 32, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aegyptii mures bipedes ambulant,</quote> <trans><tr>on two feet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 65, 85, § 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alium bipedem sibi quaerit asellum,</quote> <trans><tr>two legged ass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal genus, mortale species, terrenum vel bipes differens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5387.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, mostly contemptuously, of men: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ministro omnium non bipedum solum sed etiam quadripedum impurissimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 18, 48</bibl></cit>: Regulus omnium bipedum nequissimus, <hi rend="ital">as great a rogue as walks on two legs</hi>, Modest. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:18:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 18, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 9</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bipes asellus, of a simple man,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:92" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 92</bibl></cit>: replevit eam (terram) bipedibus et quadrupedibus. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch. 3, 32</bibl>. <cb n="BIS" /></sense></entryFree>
bipinna: <entryFree id="n5388" type="main" key="bi^pinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpinna</orth> = pipinna, q. v.</entryFree>
bipinnis: <entryFree id="n5389" type="main" key="bi^pinnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭpinnis</orth>, v. 1. bipennis.</entryFree>
biplex: <entryFree id="n5390" type="gloss" key="biplex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">biplex</orth>, <itype>duplex</itype>, <foreign lang="greek">diplou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n5390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">double</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
biprorus: <entryFree id="n5391" type="main" key="bi^pro_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭprōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-prora</etym>, of a ship, <sense id="n5391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two prows</hi> (cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 22, 24, § 82</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 168" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 168</bibl></cit>; and besides only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:ib. 277" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 277</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biremis: <entryFree id="n5392" type="main" key="bi^re_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭrēmis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-remus</etym>. <sense id="n5392.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Twooared</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having two oars</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">lembi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 40 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: scapha, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 62</bibl>.— Also, </sense><sense id="n5392.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭrēmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a small vessel with two oars</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:562" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 562</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5392.2" n="II" level="1"> Freq. in an extended signif., <hi rend="ital">having two banks of oars;</hi> only subst., <hi rend="ital">a galley with two banks of oars</hi> (cf. Dict. of Antiq.; first used by the Erythræans, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 207</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:20:section=51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 20, § 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 23, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 369</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 367</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
birotus: <entryFree id="n5393" type="main" key="bi^ro^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭrŏtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-rota</etym>, <sense id="n5393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twowheeled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with two wheels</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vehiculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 86, 30</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭrŏta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> birotūm, Cod. Th. 6, 29, 2, § 2; 8, 5, 9), <gen>f.</gen> (sc. raeda), <hi rend="ital">a cabriolet</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 8, § 1 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
birrus: <entryFree id="n5394" type="greek" key="birrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">birrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">birrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. Divers. 49" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. Divers. 49</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">purro/s</foreign> (of yellow color), <sense id="n5394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cloak to keep off rain</hi> (made of silk or wool), Edict. Diocl. p. 20; cf. Salmas. <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Carin. 20</bibl>; Burm. Anth. Lat. 2, p. 408; Cod. Th. 14, 10, 1, § 1; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:145" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sulp.</author> Sev. Dial. 1, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Epigr. 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
