bis: <entryFree id="n5395" type="main" key="bis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bis</orth>, <pos>adv. num.</pos> <etym>for duis, from duo; like bellum from duellum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=66" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 66</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:153" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 153</bibl>, and the letter B</etym>, <sense id="n5395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">twice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at two times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on two occasions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in two ways</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/s</foreign> (very freq. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n5395.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">inde ad nos elisa bis advolat (imago),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 315</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 358</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">440</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:517 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 517 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non semel sed bis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:77:section=179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 77, § 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel aut bis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis ac saepius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis mori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: bis consul, <hi rend="ital">who has been twice consul in all</hi> (diff. from iterum consul, who is a second time consul), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:23:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 23, § 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 30, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 31, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 34, 15</bibl>; 25, 5, 3; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl>.—Sometimes (among later writers) for iterum, <hi rend="ital">now a second time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 48, 20</bibl></cit>; Prid. Kal. Febr.; Coll. Leg. Mos. et Rom. 1, § 11.—</sense><sense id="n5395.2" n="2" level="3"> Bis is followed by, </sense><sense id="n5395.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Semel ... iterum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:52:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 52, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis dimicavit: semel ad Dyrrhachium, iterum in Hispaniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 36</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 6</bibl>; cf. Wolf, ejusd. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5395.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Primo... rursus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5395.5" n="(g)" level="5"> Et rursus, without a preceding primo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 48</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5395.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">doubly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twofold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in two ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a twofold manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis periit amator, ab re atque animo simul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: nam qui amat cui odio ipsus est, bis facere stulte duco; <cit><quote lang="la">laborem inanem ipsus capit, et illi molestiam adfert,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 8 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in unā civitate bis improbus fuisti, cum et remisisti quod non oportebat, et accepisti quod non licebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:23:section=59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 23, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo bis laberis, primum, quod... deinde, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopi beneficium bis dat qui dat celeriter, Publ. Syr. v. 235 Rib.: bis gratum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> v. 44</bibl></cit> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">bis est mori alterius arbitrio mori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> v. 50</bibl></cit> ib.—</sense><sense id="n5395.7" n="II" level="1"> Particular connections. </sense><sense id="n5395.8" n="A" level="2"> Bis in die, mense, anno, etc., or bis die, mense, anno, etc., <hi rend="ital">twice a day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">month</hi>, <hi rend="ital">year</hi>, etc.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl> Oud.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:Ter. 2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Ter. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis in die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:35:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 35, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:31" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 27</bibl>, n. 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 53, 74, § 146</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">cotidie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 18, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 73, 75, § 184</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5395.9" n="B" level="2"> With other numerals, and particularly with distributives (class. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">bis binos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1299</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:18:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 18, 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis quinos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 126</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:75:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 75, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:124" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis senos dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis septeni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 36, 54, § 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis octoni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis deni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 381</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 9, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9</bibl>. 78: <cit><quote lang="la">bis quinquageni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 67</bibl></cit>: bis milies, <cb n="BISG" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:55:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 55, 12</bibl>; Auct. B. Afr. 90; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5395.10" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with cardinal numbers to express <hi rend="ital">twice</hi> a given number (in the poets very freq., but not in prose): <cit><quote lang="la">bis mille sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 408</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 17</bibl>: bis sex, Varr. ap. Prob. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:31, p. 354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 31, p. 354</bibl> Lion.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis quinque viri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:500" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 500</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 579</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis trium ulnarum toga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:4:8" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 642</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">centum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:208" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 208</bibl></cit> and 209; <cit><quote lang="la">12, 188: quattuor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 72</bibl></cit>; 6, 571; 4, 220; 12, 553; 12, 554; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 39: septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:302" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:253" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 253</bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n5395.11" n="C" level="2"> Bis terve, <hi rend="ital">two</hi> or <hi rend="ital">three times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very rarely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a te bis terve summum et eas perbrevis (litteras) accepi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem bis terve bonum cum risu miror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 358</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5395.12" n="D" level="2"> Bis terque, <hi rend="ital">several times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repeatedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:82:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 82, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stulte bis terque,</quote> <trans><tr>utterly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5395.13" n="E" level="2"> Bis tanto or tantum, <hi rend="ital">twice as great</hi>, <hi rend="ital">twice as much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis tanto amici sunt inter se quam prius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:3:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 3, 2, 62</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis tantum quam tuus fundus reddit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartarus ipse Bis patet in praeceps tantum, quantus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 578</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5395.14" n="F" level="1"> Bis ad eundem (sc.: lapidem offendi, as in <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">prov.,</quote> <trans><tr>to commit the same error twice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5395.15" n="G" level="1"> Bis minus, in an old enigma in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:6:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 6, 2</bibl>, whose solution is Terminus (ter-minus): semel minusne an bis minus, non sat scio: at utrumque eorum, ut quondam audivi dicier, Jovi ipsi regi noluit concedere.!*? In composition, bis, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di/s</foreign>, loses the <hi rend="ital">s</hi>: biceps, bidens, bifer, bigener, bijugus, bilix, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">hence bissenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 812" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 812</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1282" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 1282</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:574" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 574</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and bisseni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 811</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Monos. Idyll. 12</bibl>, and <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 12, 192</bibl>, are better written as two words: bis senus (seni); so either bisextus, or as two words, bis sextus (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:1:9" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 1, 9</bibl>); v. bisextus.</sense></entryFree>
bisaccium: <entryFree id="n5396" type="hapax" key="bi^sacci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsaccĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bis-saccus</etym>, <sense id="n5396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double bag</hi>, <hi rend="ital">saddle-bags</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 31, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bisaltae: <entryFree id="n5397" type="main" key="Bi_saltae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīsaltae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bisa/ltai</foreign>, <sense id="n5397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian people on the Strymon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 461</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 10, 17, § 38</bibl>.—Hence <hi rend="ital">the country they inhabited</hi> was called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīsaltĭca</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 29, 6</bibl>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bī-saltia</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 15</bibl> (<foreign lang="greek">*bisalti/a</foreign>, Thuc.).</sense></entryFree>
bisaltis: <entryFree id="n5398" type="main" key="Bi_saltis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīsaltis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bisalti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Theophane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Bisaltes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changed by Neptune into a ewe</hi>: Bisaltida (Gr. <case>acc.</case>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 117</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 188" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 188</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bisambritae: <entryFree id="n5399" type="main" key="Bisambritae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bisambritae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people on the Indus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bisanthe: <entryFree id="n5400" type="main" key="Bisanthe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bisanthē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bisa/nqh</foreign>, <sense id="n5400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Propontis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a colony of the Samians</hi>, afterwards called <foreign lang="greek">*(paidesto/s</foreign>, now <hi rend="ital">Rodosto</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 7, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biselliarius: <entryFree id="n5401" type="gloss" key="bi^selli^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsellĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bisellium</etym>, <sense id="n5401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who enjoys the honor of the</hi> bisellium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4055</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biselliatus: <entryFree id="n5402" type="gloss" key="bi^selli^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsellĭātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the honor of a</hi> bisellium, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4043</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bisellium: <entryFree id="n5403" type="gloss" key="bi^selli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsellĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>bis-sella</etym>, <sense id="n5403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a richly ornamented seat of honor</hi> (so called because there was room for two persons upon it, although only one sat thereon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=128" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 128</bibl> Müll.). Such a bisellium has been found represented upon a Pompeian tomb with the inscription: <cit><quote lang="la">C. CALVENTIO.... BISELLII. HONOR. DATVS. EST.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4044</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4046</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4047</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4048</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biseta: <entryFree id="n5404" type="gloss" key="bi^se_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsēta</orth> porca dicitur. cujus a cervice setae bifariam dividuntur, etc., Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=33" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 33</bibl> Müll. [bis-seta].</entryFree>
bisextialis: <entryFree id="n5405" type="hapax" key="bi^sexti^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsextĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-sextus</etym>, <sense id="n5405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing two</hi> sextarii: <cit><quote lang="la">olla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bisextilis: <entryFree id="n5406" type="hapax" key="bi^sexti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsextĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bisextus</etym>, <sense id="n5406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing an intercalary day</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 17, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bisextus: <entryFree id="n5407" type="main" key="bi^sextus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭ-sextus</orth> (erroneously <orth extent="full" lang="la">bissextus</orth>; v. bis <sense id="n5407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, sc. dies (<orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsextum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 1, 7</bibl>) [bis], <hi rend="ital">an intercalary day;</hi> so called, since the 24th of February = VI. Cal. Mart., was doubled: <cit><quote lang="la">bisextus est post annos quattuor unus dies adjectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 17, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:98" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:3:section=3" default="NO">4, 4, 3, § 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 17, 25</bibl>-27.</sense></entryFree>
bisgargitani: <entryFree id="n5408" type="main" key="Bisgargi^ta_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bisgargĭtāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 23</bibl>. <pb n="240" /> <cb n="BITH" /></sense></entryFree>
bisolis:
<entryFree id="n5409" type="hapax" key="bi^so^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsŏlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-solea</etym>, <sense id="n5409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two</hi> (<hi rend="ital">foot</hi>) <hi rend="ital">soles</hi>, Edict. Diocl. p. 20.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsōmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vox hibrida, from bis-<foreign lang="greek">sw=ma</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a sarcophagus for two persons</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Rein.</author> 20, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bison: <entryFree id="n5410" type="greek" key="bi^son"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭson</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">bi/swn</foreign> [acc. to Oppian. Cyn. 2, 155, named from the Thracian <foreign lang="greek">*bi/stones</foreign>], <sense id="n5410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of wild ox living in northern regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Urus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the humpbacked ox</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bison</hi>: Bos bison, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 15, 15, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 65" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 23:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 23, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bisonus: <entryFree id="n5411" type="main" key="bi^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-sono</etym>, <sense id="n5411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding twice</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 618</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bispellio: <entryFree id="n5412" type="main" key="bispellio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bispellio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>bis-pellis</etym>, only trop., <sense id="n5412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man with two skins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cunning man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:3:72" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 3, 72</bibl>; also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">bisbel-lio</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:31" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 2, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bissenusandbisseni: <entryFree id="n5413" type="main" key="bisse_nus and bisse_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bissēnus and bissēni, v. bis fin</orth>.</entryFree>
bissextus: <entryFree id="n5414" type="main" key="bissextus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bissextus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">v</orth>. bisextus.</entryFree>
bistones: <entryFree id="n5415" type="main" key="Bisto^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bistŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bi/stones</foreign>, <sense id="n5415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Bistones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Thracian people south of Mount Rhodope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from Abdera</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 42</bibl>.—In the poets, </sense><sense id="n5415.1" n="B" level="2"> In gen., for <hi rend="ital">the Thracians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 569</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Bistonas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:83" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:76" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5415.2" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5415.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bistŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bisto/nios</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Bistones.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5415.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Bistonian</hi>: plăgae. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5415.5" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rupes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 30, 36: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <trans><tr>the Thracians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:430" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 430</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:3:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 1, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Minerva (as goddess of the warlike Thracians),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:377" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tereus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Thracian king Diomedes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves, i. e. grues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a violent north wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 767</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensis Tydei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:586" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 586</bibl></cit>: chelys, <hi rend="ital">the lyre of the Thracian Orpheus</hi>, Claud. Rapt. Pros. praef. 2, 8 al.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bistŏ-nĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bistonia</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Thrace</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bistoniae magnus alumnus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Orpheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:159" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5415.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bistŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bistoni/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Bistones</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">Thracian</hi>: ora. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15</bibl> (16), 344: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:9:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 2, 9, 54</bibl></cit>: ales i. e. <hi rend="ital">Procne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of the Thracian king Tereus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 670" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 670</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5415.7" n="2" level="3"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a Thracian woman</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bistonidum crines,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Thracian Bacchantes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:19:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 19, 20</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 164</bibl>, ubi v. Sillig.</sense></entryFree>
bisulcilingua: <entryFree id="n5416" type="hapax" key="bi^sulci^lingua"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsulcĭlingua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bisulcuslingua</etym>, <sense id="n5416.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a cloven tongue;</hi> trop., of <hi rend="ital">a hypocrite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a double-tongued</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deceitful person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bisulcilingua, quasi proserpens bestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bisulcus: <entryFree id="n5417" type="main" key="bi^sulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsulcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-sulcus</etym> (twofurrowed), hence, in gen., <sense id="n5417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">divided into two parts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">two-cleft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cloven</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): lingua, <hi rend="ital">forked</hi>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 506, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 65</bibl>: pedes, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 356</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 105, § 254</bibl>: ungula, a <hi rend="ital">cloven hoof</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 21, 30, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 1, 1, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 29, 46, § 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forcipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 28, 34, § 97</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5417.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsulca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. animalia), <hi rend="ital">animals with cloven feet</hi> (opp. to the solidipedes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 85, § 212</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornigera fere bisulca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 255</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:184" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 65, 84, § 184</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:199" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 73, 93, § 199</bibl>.—Rare in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">bisulcum oryx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 255</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bisyllabus: <entryFree id="n5418" type="main" key="bi^sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭsyllăbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-syllaba</etym>, <sense id="n5418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissyllabic</hi>: sic Socer, Macer. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:52:151" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, 52, 151</bibl>.—Spelled <orth extent="full" lang="la">bissyllăbus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Diff. 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bithiae: <entryFree id="n5419" type="main" key="Bithiae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bithiae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of certain women in Scythia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">said to have two pupils in each eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bithynia: <entryFree id="n5420" type="main" key="Bi_thy_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīthȳnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*biquni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n5420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a very fruitful province in Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the Propontis and the Black Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where the Romans carried on a considerable trade</hi> (its inhabitants were, acc. to Herod. 7, 75, Thracians, who had wandered there), now <hi rend="ital">Ejalet Anadoli</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:11:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 11, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:18:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 18, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Imp. Pomp. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 6</bibl> and 12; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 247</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:16:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 16, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5420.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n5420.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīthȳnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Bithynian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Bithynia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">societas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nicomedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volusius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">an agnomen of</hi> Q. Pompeius, <hi rend="ital">as conqueror of Bithynia</hi>, Fest. s. v. rutrum, p. 223; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:240" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 240</bibl>.—And of the son of the same, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 23, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5420.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīthȳnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Bithynian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diophanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—And in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīthȳnĭi</orth>,<cb n="BIVI" />  <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 69</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5420.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīthȳ-nus</orth> (once Bithȳnus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:15" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 15</bibl> Jahn), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Bithynian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 35, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:162" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 33</bibl></cit>.—And in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīthȳni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*biqunoi/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:1" default="NO">1, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:2" default="NO">2, 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 41, § 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:150" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 32, 43, § 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 201</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 239</bibl> and 467.—</sense><sense id="n5420.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīthȳ-nis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*biquni/s</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n5420.6" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A Bithynian woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 6, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5420.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the island</hi> Thynias, <hi rend="ital">in the</hi> Pontus Euxinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5420.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">An otherwise unknown town in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5420.9" n="E" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bīthȳ-nĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*biqu/nion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a town in Bithynia</hi>, afterwards called Claudiopolis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bitias: <entryFree id="n5421" type="main" key="Bi^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭtĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n5421.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A Tyrian nobleman at Dido</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s court</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:738" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 738</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5421.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Son of Alcanor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and a companion of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:672" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 672</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 396</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bitienses: <entryFree id="n5422" type="gloss" key="bi_ti^enses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bītĭenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>beto</etym>, <sense id="n5422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">those who are continually wandering about</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
bito: <entryFree id="n5423" type="main" key="bi_to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bīto</orth>, v. beto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5424" type="main" key="Bi^to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭton</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bi/twn</foreign>, <sense id="n5424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of the Argive priestess Cydippe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and brother of Cleobis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for his filial affection</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:47:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 47, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4</bibl>, ext. 4 (cf. Herod. 1, 31).</sense></entryFree>
bittis: <entryFree id="n5425" type="main" key="Bittis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bittis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bitti/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman beloved by the poet Philetas of Cos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 1, 58</bibl> Merkel (al. Battis).</sense></entryFree>
bituitus: <entryFree id="n5426" type="main" key="Bitui_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bituītus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Arverni</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bitumen: <entryFree id="n5427" type="foreign" key="bi^tu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭtūmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>cf. Sanscr. gatu, gum</etym>, <sense id="n5427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bitumen</hi>, a kind of mineral pitch found in Palestine and Babylon, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/tfaltos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:178 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 15, 51, § 178 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:808" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 808</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:660" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 660</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 792</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 1</bibl> sqq.: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaicum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 56, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 83, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 14, 1: Apollonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 6, 14</bibl>.—For magical or religious use, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:82" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 325</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bitumineus: <entryFree id="n5428" type="hapax" key="bi^tu_mi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭtūmĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bitumen</etym>, <sense id="n5428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of bitumen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bituminous</hi>: vires, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> circumlocution for bitumen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 350</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bitumino: <entryFree id="n5429" type="main" key="bi^tu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭtūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cover</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impregnate with bitumen</hi> (late Lat.), Ambros. Hexaëm. 6, 9, 72; cf.: bitumino, <foreign lang="greek">a)sfalto/w</foreign>, Gloss. Lab.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭtū-mĭnătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">impregnated with bitumen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bituminous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 6, 32, § 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bituminosus: <entryFree id="n5430" type="main" key="bi^tu_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭtūmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abounding in bitumen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bituminous</hi> (perh. only in the two foll. exs.): <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bituriges: <entryFree id="n5431" type="main" key="Bi^tu^ri^ges"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭtŭrĭges</orth>, <itype>um</itype> (in <number>sing.</number> Biturix, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 423</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*bitou/ri^ges</foreign>, <sense id="n5431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Bituriges</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Aquitania, <hi rend="ital">divided into two tribes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5431.1" n="A" level="2"> Bituriges Cubi, <foreign lang="greek">*bit. *kou=boi</foreign>, Strab., the present <hi rend="ital">Berry</hi>, Départ. du Cher. et de l'Indre, whose capital was Avaricum, now <hi rend="ital">Bourges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and without Cubi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5431.2" n="B" level="2"> Bituriges Vivisci, <foreign lang="greek">*bit. *ou)i+skoi/</foreign>, Ptol., whose chief city was Burdigala, now <hi rend="ital">Bordeaux</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 108</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi> Biturix, <hi rend="ital">one of the Bituriges</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 423</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 190</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5431.3" n="II" level="1"> Deriv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭ-tŭrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of the Bituriges</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis (very much valued),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:7:1" default="NO">3, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:9:1" default="NO">3, 9, 1</bibl>; 3, 21, 3 and 10. Also in the form <orth extent="full" lang="la">Bĭtŭrĭgĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
biuri: <entryFree id="n5432" type="gloss" key="bi^u_ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭūri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hibrida, from bis-<foreign lang="greek">ou)/ra</foreign>, two-tailed</etym>, <sense id="n5432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of rodent animals found in Campania</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 15, 52, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bivertex: <entryFree id="n5433" type="main" key="bi^vertex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭvertex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-vertex</etym>, <sense id="n5433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with two summits</hi> or <hi rend="ital">peaks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parnassus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:628" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
bivira: <entryFree id="n5434" type="main" key="bi^vi^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭvĭra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>bis-vir</etym>, <sense id="n5434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a woman married to a second husband</hi> (opp. univira), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 79, 21 sq.</bibl> (Sat. Menipp. 48, 5).</sense></entryFree>
bivius: <entryFree id="n5435" type="main" key="bi^vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭvĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>bis-via</etym>, <sense id="n5435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having two ways</hi> or <hi rend="ital">passages</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): fauces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 516</bibl></cit>.—So, calles, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:395" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 395</bibl>: <cb n="BLAN" /> di, deae, <hi rend="ital">worshipped at cross-roads</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2105</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5435.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭvĭi</orth> (sc. di), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 389</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2104</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5435.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">bĭvĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a place with two ways</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">where two ways meet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5435.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bivio portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 238</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad bivia consistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 11, 4</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n5435.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: bivium nobis ad culturam dedit natura, experientiam et imitationem, <hi rend="ital">a twofold means</hi> or <hi rend="ital">method</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:18:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 18, 7</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">a twofold love</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 486</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bizone: <entryFree id="n5436" type="main" key="Bizo_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bizōnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 44</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
bizya: <entryFree id="n5437" type="main" key="Bizy^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Bizya</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n5437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Thrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">once the royal residence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 47</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blachnon: <entryFree id="n5438" type="main" key="blachnon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blachnon</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">blech-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">blh=xnon</foreign>, <sense id="n5438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of fern</hi> (filix), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 9, 55, § 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blactero: <entryFree id="n5439" type="greek" key="blacte^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blactĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf.: balo, blatio</etym>, <sense id="n5439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bleat</hi>, of the ram, Auct. Carm. Philom. 56.</sense></entryFree>
blaesus: <entryFree id="n5440" type="greek" key="blaesus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blaesus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">blaiso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n5440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lisping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stammering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitating in utterance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speaking indistinctly</hi> (most freq. in poetry): blaesus, cui litterae sibilantes (s, z) molestae sunt vitioseque pronunciantur, Popm. Differ. p. 133; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:65:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 65, 10</bibl>.—Of a parrot: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">blaesus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one who lisps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:1:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 21, 1, 10</bibl>.—Of intoxicated persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 48</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:598" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 598</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n5441" type="main" key="Blaesus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Blaesus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n5441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen in the Sempronian</hi> gens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:191" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 21 al.</bibl>; 6, 40.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Blaesĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Blœsus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:38:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 38, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blanda: <entryFree id="n5442" type="main" key="Blanda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Blanda</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n5442.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A maritime town in Lucania</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Maratea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 10, § 72</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20, 5</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Blandae</orth>, ārum).—</sense><sense id="n5442.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small maritime town in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, now <hi rend="ital">Blanes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:6:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 6, 5</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 22</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Blandae</orth>, ārum).</sense></entryFree>
blande: <entryFree id="n5443" type="main" key="blande_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. blandus <sense id="n5443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
blandicella: <entryFree id="n5444" type="gloss" key="blandi^cella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭcella</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, <sense id="n5444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coaxing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flattering words</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=35" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 35</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
blandicule: <entryFree id="n5445" type="hapax" key="blandi^cu^le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭcŭlē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> of an adj. not in use, blandiculus [blandus], <sense id="n5445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flatteringly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 252</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blandidicus: <entryFree id="n5446" type="hapax" key="blandi^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>blandusdico</etym>, <sense id="n5446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking soothingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coaxingly</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blandificus: <entryFree id="n5447" type="hapax" key="blandi^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>blandusfacio</etym>, <sense id="n5447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 888</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blandifluus: <entryFree id="n5448" type="main" key="blandi^flu_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭflūus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>blandus-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n5448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">flowing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">diffusing itself sweetly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasantly</hi>: odor, Ven. Carm. 11, 10, 10.</sense></entryFree>
blandiloquens: <entryFree id="n5449" type="hapax" key="blandi^lo^quens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭlŏquens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>blandus loquor</etym>, <sense id="n5449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking courteously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatteringly</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">soothingly</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 7, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blandiloquentia: <entryFree id="n5450" type="hapax" key="blandi^lo^quenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭlŏquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>blandilo quens</etym>, <sense id="n5450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">coaxing language</hi>, <hi rend="ital">softness of expression</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D. 3, 25, 65</bibl> (Trag. v. 227 Rib., or v. 305 Vahl.).</sense></entryFree>
blandiloquentulus: <entryFree id="n5451" type="hapax" key="blandi^lo^quentu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭlŏquentŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n5451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">speaking caressingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair-spoken</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
blandiloquium: <entryFree id="n5452" type="hapax" key="blandi^lo^qui^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭlŏquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>blandus-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n5452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soft words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattering speech</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Hier. 19:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Hier. 19, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blandiloquus: <entryFree id="n5453" type="main" key="blandi^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n5453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking smoothly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flatteringly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fair-spoken</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut blandiloqu'est! Hei mihi metuo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:5:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 5, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 289" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 289</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blandimentum: <entryFree id="n5454" type="main" key="blandi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>blandior</etym>. <sense id="n5454.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">flattering words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blandishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">complimentary speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flattery</hi> (class.; most freq. in <number>plur.</number> and in Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec eam (virtutem) minis aut blandimentis corrupta deseret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:31:87" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 31, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessum dedisti me blandimentis tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa igitur blandimenta plebi per id tempus ab senatu data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captus blandimentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:19:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 19, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per blandimenta juvenem aggredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebribus blandimentis infectae epistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 74</bibl></cit>.—In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 4</bibl>.—And in <usg type="style">poet.</usg> exuberance: <cit><quote lang="la">cui blandimenta precesque Verbaque jactanti mitissima, desine, dixit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 815</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5454.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5454.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Any thing that pleases the senses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an object that charms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an allurement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa nobis blandimenta natura ipsa genuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 41</bibl></cit>: blandimenta vitae <pb n="241" /> <cb n="BLAN" /> = res, quae vitam jucundam reddunt), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 53</bibl> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">delinimenta vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 63</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">aestivi caloris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vecturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 28, 37</bibl></cit>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the spices</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seasoning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">condiments</hi> in food, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 141, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5454.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Healing applications</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cures</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alia quoque blandimenta excogitabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5454.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Careful culture</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc blandimento (i. e. blanda cultura) impetratis radicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 13, 21, § 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blandio: <entryFree id="n5455" type="main" key="blandi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype> (<sense id="n5455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form of blandior), <hi rend="ital">to caress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">court</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ego blandirem (mulierem),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 87, p. 328 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Part. pass.</hi>: blanditusque labor molli curabitur arte, Verr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 792</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">blandiendo duce nutrivit malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 135" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 135</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
blandior: <entryFree id="n5456" type="main" key="blandi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>blandus</etym>. <sense id="n5456.0" n="I" level="1"> Prop., lit., <hi rend="ital">to cling caressingly to one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fawn upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to flatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">caress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fondle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">coax</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n5456.1" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matri interfectae infante miserabiliter blandiente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 88</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5456.2" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 37, 52, § 109</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5456.3" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem pueriliter blandientem patri ut duceretur in Hispaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5456.4" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cessit immanis tibi blandienti Janitor aulae Cerberus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantusque in eo vigor, et dulcis quidam blandientis risus apparuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:4:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et modo blanditur, modo... Terret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 416</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5456.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5456.6" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to flatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make flattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">courteous speeches</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be complaisant to.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5456.7" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostro ordini palam blandiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandiri eis subtiliter a quibus est petendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur matri praeterea blanditur?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 37, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">durae supplex blandire puellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:527" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 527</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic (Venus) patruo blandita suo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 532</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 440</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 705</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5456.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe qui litigare se simulans blandiatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:26:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 26, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua juvet, mentemque tegat. Blandire, noceque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in blandiendo (vox) lenis et summissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidum blandita,</quote> <trans><tr>timidly coaxing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:569" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 569</bibl></cit>: qui cum dolet blanditur, post tempus sapit, Publ. Syr. v. 506 Rib.—</sense><sense id="n5456.9" n="3" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">per</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Commageno mirifice mihi et per se et per Pomponium blanditur Appius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10</bibl></cit> (12), 2.— </sense><sense id="n5456.10" n="4" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">torrenti ac meditatā cotidie oratione blandiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 3, 7, § 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5456.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n5456.12" n="1" level="3"> Blandiri sibi, etc., <hi rend="ital">to flatter one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self with something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fancy something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delude one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandiuntur enim sibi, qui putant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:7:3:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 26, 7, 3, § 2</bibl></cit>.—So often in Dig. et Codd.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ne nobis blandiar,</quote> <trans><tr>not to flatter ourselves</tr>, <tr>to tell the whole truth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:126" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5456.13" n="2" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to persuade</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impel by flattery</hi> ( = blandiendo persuadeo or compello—very rare). </sense><sense id="n5456.14" n="a" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(ipsa voluptas) res per Veneris blanditur saecla propagent ( = sic blanditur ut propagent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 173</bibl></cit> Lachm.—</sense><sense id="n5456.15" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum etiam saepe blandiatur gratia conviviorum a veris indiciis ad falsam probationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3 praef.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n5456.16" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n5456.17" n="A" level="2"> Of inanim. things as subjects, <hi rend="ital">to flatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">please</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be agreeable</hi> or <hi rend="ital">favorable to; to allure by pleasure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to attract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n5456.18" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">video quam suaviter voluptas sensibus nostris blandiatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 45, 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">blandiebatur coeptis fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n5456.19" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna cum blanditur captatum venit, Publ. Syr. v. 167 Rib: blandiente inertiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignoscere vitiis blandientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 17, § 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n5456.20" n="3" level="3"> With <case>abl.</case>: opportuna suā blanditur populus umbrā, Ov M. 10, 555.—</sense><sense id="n5456.21" n="B" level="2"> Of things as objects: <cit><quote lang="la">cur ego non votis blandiar ipse meis?</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>believe what I wish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:11:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 11, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi tamen auribus nostris bibliopolae blandiuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>tickle with flattery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n5456.22" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">blandĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a flatterer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus blandientes incorruptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n5456.23" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">blandītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pleasant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 72: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
